The ticket rate from Kottayam to Alappuzha will be Rs 50 for non-AC seats and Rs 100 for the AC cabin seats. The fare for the tour to Kumarakom will be Rs 200 for non-AC and Rs 300 for AC seats.

The ferry, with an average speed of 10 knots (around 18.5km per hour), will take only two hours to cover the 32-km-long route between Kottayam and Alappuzha. The boat will start its first trip every day at 7am from Kodimatha boat jetty in Kottayam and arrive at Alapppuzha jetty by 9.30am. The conducted tour will start at 10am from Alappuzha boat jetty and will move to Punnamada Kayal, the venue of Nehru Trophy regatta, Muhamma, Thanneermukkom fish market and panchayat, its famous bund, Kumarakom bird sanctuary and Pathiramanal island. The boat will also have a snack bar and hotel operated by Kudumbashree members. They will get Alappuzha style fish curry, snacks and other food items from there.

The tourists will be allowed to spend time at least 15 minutes at each destination. They can buy fish and other products. The boat will reach its final destination in Kumarakom by 1pm.

Title: Tit for tat: Civic body returns litter to shop that dumped it
Content:
Trichy: The officials of K Abishekapuram zone of Trichy City Corporation have returned the litter dumped by a shop in Konkkarai locality near the Kudamurutti River. Night-watchers appointed by the corporation noticed a vehicle dumping waste on Monday night.

The corporation officials said that a mini-truck was found dumping waste on Monday night at Konakkarai falling under ward 57. Though the night-watchers failed to catch the offenders on the spot, the team after checking the waste found receipts and bills belonging to one automobile spare parts shop at Melapudur. An inquiry revealed that people from the automobile spare parts shop had dumped plastic discards, mostly covers used to wrap automobile components.

“We tracked down the shop and sent the waste back to them on Tuesday morning. As the staff confessed to the offence, we did not impose any fines on them, but warned them not to repeat it,” a corporation official said. K Abishekapuram zone has appointed 20 sanitary workers on night duty to prevent dumping of waste on vacant lands. They will monitor the localities vulnerable to littering in Konakkarai, Kulimikkarai Road, Karur Bypass Road, Salai Road and Kulumani Road. “The night-watchers will be on duty between 10 pm and 6 am,” the official added. The civic body claimed that littering on vacant plots have come down significantly due to the presence of the night-watchers.

Title: Jamia opens reading hall after 3 months
Content:
New Delhi: Almost three months after the violence erupted inside the Jamia Millia Islamia premises on December 15 , Dr Zakir Husain Library’s reading hall was opened for the students on Wednesday.

“The library re-opened after an extensive renovation and facelifting, and was hugely welcomed by the student community. With nearly 800 seating capacity consisting of a reading hall, research floor, reference and periodical section and a well-equipped digital resource centre comprising 150 computers, the library resumed all its services today,” the university said in its statement.

The administration added that the “library proposes to strengthen its user services in coming days by extensively leveraging information and communication technologies. It is a matter of great satisfaction that despite heavy odds, the library has been able to utilise its budgetary allocation completely and renew its subscription to electronic databases.”

The three months when the library was closed were also utilsed for migrating the library management software to an open source software from the commercial one for more effective integration and discovery of resources, the varsity stated.

Officiating vice-chancellor Ilyas Husain said that he hopes the old section of the library will also be opened soon. It was the videos from the old section of the library that had gone viral last month. In the several CCTV footages, the varsity students were seen being attacked by lathi-wielding cops.

Title: Coronavirus scare in Pune: Cabbies wary of picking passengers from airport
Content: PUNE: With reports of the taxi driver, who ferried the Coronavirus-affected city couple from Mumbai to Pune on March 1 also testing positive for the flu, cabbies in the city, especially those who undertake inter-city rides and pick up passengers from the airport, are a worried lot.Kamlesh, a driver on a cab aggregator platform, said he recently cancelled the ride of a passenger who wanted to travel to Navi Mumbai from the Pune airport Another driver, who did not wish to be named, said, “Carrying passengers from the airport has become a scary affair now.” The city-based couple, who tested positive for the Coronavirus , had travelled to Dubai in the last week of February and used a private cab to travel from Mumbai to Pune on March 1.The driver, who ferried the couple, had initially claimed that he worked for Ola. However, Pune divisional commissioner Dipak Mhaisekar told TOI. “Upon further investigation, we have come to know that the driver does not belong to the Ola platform. We have sought help from the cops for his call record details. Once we have the list, we will contact the people, including passengers, he was in touch with,” he said. An Uber spokesperson said that drivers had been informed about the dos and don’ts. “We are supporting drivers and delivery people diagnosed with COVID-19 or placed in quarantine by a public health authority. They will receive compensation for a period of up to 14 days,” Andrew Macdonald, senior vice-president, rides and platform, Uber said.Guru Katti, president, Swarajya Vahan Chalak Sanghatna, said that more than 500 face masks had been distributed among the drivers. “If they are waiting at the airport, they should always wear a mask. Also, we have asked them to use gloves if they touch the luggage of passengers at the airport,” he said. Ola officials said, “Our walk-in centres across cities have been equipped with sanitisers and masks, which can be used by drivers,” an Ola spokesperson said.

Title: Usurping govt land: HC orders probe by independent agency
Content:
Kochi: The high court has ordered the state government to conduct an inquiry by an independent agency on the practice of landless persons obtaining government property and selling it to land mafia by acting in nexus.

Justice P Somarajan issued the order after considering two separate cases where sale agreements were signed for lands assigned to landless persons even before the ban on alienation of the assigned lands was over. The cases reached the court as dispute rose between subsequent buyers regarding execution of the agreements.

To circumvent the clause in the pattayam preventing alienation for a period of three years, the period of contract for sale was agreed and fixed just after expiry of three years, the court pointed out. Also, relaxation was given by the government to the seven-year ban on alienation to three years, the judgment said.

If the government has introduced the ban on alienation for the benefit of landless person, there should necessarily be adequate measure to preserve the land for the landless, the court said. But, instead of incorporating adequate measures, a relaxation has been given by the government to sell the property to strangers just upon completion of three years, the judgment stated.

The striking similarity in the two cases would certainly show that it is not an exception but an indication of large-scale manipulation, the court said.

In the instant cases, not only did the property assigned to landless person change hands prior to the expiry of the ban on alienation, the state government has so far not challenged or objected it, the court pointed out.

“The state government is duty bound to protect the interests of landless person... The reduction of period of restriction… gives the land mafia a shot in the arm in getting the property of landless person in their name. This would show an illegal nexus between the land mafia and landless persons in extorting the property belonging to the state government…,” the court said in the judgment.

“The reduction of period of alienation into three years further encourages an easy mode to plunder the property of state government. Since it is not an exception but involves systematic gobbling up of property belonging to the government in large scale under the veneer of landless persons, a detailed enquiry by an independent agency is imperative and the state government is duty bound to conduct such an enquiry to expose the nefarious activities of the land mafia,” the court added.

Title: Work on RWH pits begins near Central bus stand
Content:
Trichy: The corporation has started work on constructing roadside rainwater harvesting pits in two low-lying areas on VOC road near the Central bus stand at an outlay of Rs 1 lakh. The two inundation prone spots are located near the District Industries Centre (DIC) and opposite to the corporation’s two-wheeler parking lot in the bus stand. The pits will be two-feet deep with each having perforated PVC pipe going a depth of 12m.

“The pits will be filled with sand and gravel to filter the water. Since each of the borewells are 12m deep and six-inch in diameter, they will be sufficient enough to prevent water stagnation,” an official with Trichy Corporation said. The rainwater harvesting pits shall be positioned in vacant adjacent spaces along the roads and will not affect vehicular movement.

The move comes after the success of rainwater harvesting pit established near Cantonment police station. The junction where Reynolds and Benwells roads meet is now free from water stagnation ever since the rainwater harvesting pit was established.

Trichy Corporation said that a survey is underway to identify inundation prone areas for establishing similar roadside rainwater harvesting pits.

Title: Ex-Patparganj MLA to head DPCC
Content:
New Delhi: In a bid to involve young leaders to lead the party, Congress on Wednesday appointed former MLA Anil Chaudhary as the president of Delhi Pradesh Congress Committee ( DPCC ).

Chaudhary (44) represented east Delhi’s Patparganj assembly constituency from 2008 to 2013. Prior to that, he had won the civic body elections twice and was the president of Delhi Youth Congress .

Of the five vice-presidents appointed by Congress interim-president Sonia Gandhi on Wednesday, four are less than 50 years of age. They include municipal councillor Abhishek Dutt, Shivani Chopra, Mudit Agarwal and Ali Hassan, apart from veteran party leader and three-time MLA Jai Kishan.

Other than Mudit, all the four newly appointed vice-presidents had contested the recently concluded state assembly elections.

While Mudit is the son of veteran leader and former MP JP Agarwal, Shivani’s father Subhash Chopra is the outgoing chief of Delhi Congress . Ali Hassan’s father Hasaan Ahmed was elected MLA from Mustafabad twice in 2008 and 2013.

Subhash Chopra had resigned as DPCC chief taking moral responsibility for the party’s debacle in the state polls. Appointed in October, three months after his predecessor Sheila Dikshit died in July 2019, Chopra held that position for a brief period of five months.

After three consecutive defeats in state polls, including two complete routs in 2015 and 2020 when it failed to even win a single seat in the 70 member House, Congress in the capital is in a shambles at the moment. In the recent polls, the party could barely manage 4.3% votes.

“I agree that the condition of the party is not good. Congress took its vision to the people of Delhi and highlighted the failures of the rival parties. People also appreciate Congress government’s contribution between 1998 and 2013 but it did not translate into votes,” Chaudhary added.

Title: MLA: Theerthapada Mandapam should be opened immediately
Content:
Thiruvananthapuram: The takeover of Theerthapada Mandapam is a classic instance of anti-Hindu sentiments of the communist government in Kerala, said MLA O Rajagopal on Tuesday.

Inaugurating a protest dharna staged by various Hindu outfits against the revenue department taking over Theerthapada Mandapam, he said that the government should immediately reopen Theerthapada Mandapam for the people.

“Chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan had personally assured to lay the foundation stone for Chattambi Swami memorial on March 10. However, the revenue department overruled that assurance and took control of Theerthapada Mandapam. Devotees are apprehensive that many articles kept inside the temple would be lost,” he said.

Chattambi Swami was the pioneer of the Hindu renaissance movement in Kerala. “It has been a long-cherished dream to build a memorial for Swami who was born and raised in Thiruvananthapuram,” he said.

The dharna concluded with an exhortation for stronger and more protests. Corporation parliamentary party leader M R Gopan, office bearers of various Hindu outfits, Vidyadhiraja Trust spoke on the occasion.

Title: Cops baffled as Pudukottai man claims to be ‘Salem stoneman’
Content:
Rajesh Kumar

SALEM: Who is the real ‘ Salem stoneman ’ is the question that is haunting the city police as a 27-year-old habitual offender has recently confessed to the three murders that sent shock waves in the city in the first three days of February. His confession comes more than two weeks after the arrest of a 20-year-old man, who had earlier confessed to have bludgeoned the three to death with stones to steal money to buy ganja.

In the wake of recent developments, police not only denied to have obtained confessional statement from M Andisamy, of Sitheriyur village in Dindigul district, under any duress, but also said the school topper in Class X board exams was sent behind bars only after forensic labs in Chennai and Bengluru confirmed that the images in the CCTV footages from the crime scenes matched with that of Andisamy.

City police commissioner T Senthil Kumar said, “We arrested Andisamy on February 21 based on his confessional statement. Evidence that were collected from the crime spots also matched nearly 70% with his statements.”

However, Pudukottai-based Rajesh Kumar’s confession to the crimes have left the city police, who had earlier formed 16 special teams to crack the case, in a predicament again.

Senthil Kumar said the statements of Rajesh and material evidence such as his clothes were matching with the evidence that were collected from the crime scenes.

Arrested by the Pudukottai district police on March 6 in connection with a robbery case, Rajesh told them that he was the one who murdered two beggars and a night security in Salem on February 1, 2 and 3. They alerted their counterparts in Salem on March 7 and the latter took Rajesh into the custody on Monday. An orphan, Rajesh is also a ganja addict like Andisamy.

According to an investigation officer, Rajesh had committed his first murder at the age of 13. “He murdered a girl in 2009 in Trichy by pushing her into a well. He was sentenced to four years imprisonment and sent to a borstal.”

The officer said while Rajesh was said to have bludgeoned a pedestrian to death in Karur district in 2015 and murdered another person in Trichy city in 2018, there weren’t any charges pending against him regarding those two cases.

“However, the Srirangam police in Trichy had arrested him in November 2019 in connection with a murder that was reported in their police limits. He came out on bail in January 2020,” the officer said.

Senthil Kumar said Rajesh’s photos and CCTV footages from crime spots have been sent to the forensic lab in Chennai for verifying facts.

While Rajesh has been lodged in the Salem Central Prison on Tuesday, the city police have approached the Salem district court, seeking its direction to remove Andisamy’s names from the three murder case files.

The city police commissioner said his department would take the responsibility of rehabilitating Andisamy, a ganja addict, if he was found not guilty. “We will first interrogate him and rehabilitate him, if he is found to be innocent.”

It is to be noted that Andisamy is said to have bludgeoned an alms seeker to death with a stone in Velankanni in December 2019.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Man arrested for hate speech against government, police
Content:
Representative image

COIMBATORE: A 39-year-old man was arrested and lodged in the Coimbatore Central Prison on Tuesday for his hate speech against the RSS, BJP and police department during an anti-CAA meeting that was held at Selvapuram here in February.

The Selvapuram police identified the accused as P Balamurugan alias Ayya Vazhi Balamurugan, of Palayamkottai in Tirunelveli district. He was booked under Sections 143 (punishment for unlawful assembly), 153 (B) (imputations, assertions prejudicial to national integration), 341 (punishment for wrongful restraint), 502 (sale of printed or engraved substance containing defamatory matter) and 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace) of the Indian Penal Code.

Meanwhile, a video of Balamurugan went viral on social media on Tuesday in which he said the Islamic outfits had paid him Rs500 and taken care of his travel and food expenses for speaking in their meetings. “If my speech has hurt the central and state government, police department and Hindu people, I am apologizing. Hereafter, I won’t participate in such meeting and protest,” he said in the video.

Founder of Ayyavazhi Yuga Peravai, a police officer said, Balamurugan used to attend anti-CAA meetings that were conducted by various Muslim outfits in the state. “On February 22, he addressed a public meeting at Selvapuram and requested the Muslim women to beat policemen with sandals or broomsticks if they enter their protest site. He also said many Muslims had deserted the AIADMK after the ruling party supported the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) in parliament and defamed the Muslims, who were still supporting the party. He also blamed the BJP and RSS.”

Police have also formed a special team to nab a few more people for their hate speech.

Title: BDU asst professor booked for sexual assault on PhD scholar
Content:
Trichy: An assistant professor from the Bharathidasan University has been booked by the all woman police station (AWPS) Thiruverumbur after a sexual harassment complaint was filed by a research scholar. He has been booked under section 354A for sexual harassment.

According to the victim, the faculty member had made sexual advances citing inability to have physical relationship with his wife over medical grounds.

Although she lodged a complaint with the vice-chancellor, who assured to get her another guide, other faculty members refused to guide her. Subsequently, the vice-chancellor told her that she would be admitted to any of the affiliated colleges under the university.

She approached the Trichy superintendent of police following which a case was booked at the AWPS Thiruverumbur on February 25. On Monday, the victim approached the district collector seeking action against the faculty member.

Speaking to TOI, registrar G Gopinath said that an internal complaints committee has been constituted as per UGC directives. “The inquiry will conclude on Wednesday and the committee is likely to submit the report soon. Action will be initiated based on the report,” he said. Thiruverumbur DSP Y Suresh Kumar said that action will be initiated based on the internal report.

Title: High court grants nod for anti-CAA meet in Tuticorin
Content:
Representative image

The Madras high court on Tuesday granted permission for conducting a public meeting against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC) in Tuticorin.

A I Kidar Bisme, co-ordinator of “Thoothukudi Kudiyurimai Thirutha Satta Ethirppu Pala Samaya Periyakkam” in Tuticorin, had filed a petition stating that on February 11 he had sought permission from the superintendent of police and inspector of the Tuticorin South police station for conducting a public meeting at VVD Signal opposite to Chidambaram Nagar bus stop on March 8.

The inspector of Tuticorin South police station passed an order on March 4 denying permission citing law and order issues.

It was stated that the inspector had not considered the petitioner’s representation in a proper perspective in the light of Right to Speech and expression. He also stated that the meeting would be conducted peacefully and that the inspector could not curtail his fundamental right.

Justice G R Swaminathan before whom the petition came up for hearing, granted permission for the meeting.

Title: Pune: Revellers shun big get-togethers, most stay at home due to coronavirus
Content:
Covid-19 scare doesn’t deter the enthusiastic spirits of Puneites from celebrating Holi.

PUNE: Muted celebrations marked the festival of colours in the city on Tuesday, with the cancellation of several Holi parties and events in the wake of the novel coronavirus (Covid-19) scare.

While several youths could be seen taking to the streets with colours to celebrate the festival, most citizens either stayed home or restricted the celebrations to their housing societies, especially after two persons tested positive for the contagion in the city on Monday evening. The number of positive cases reached five by Tuesday late evening.

IT professional Prerna Goyal said, “We had initially planned to go out to play Holi at a friend’s housing society. This plan was, however, scrapped due to the coronavirus scare. Eventually, we restricted the celebration to our home with some of our family members paying us a visit during the day.”

A Wakad resident said his society members indulged in “a sort of dry holi” celebrations. “We did not use water to celebrate the festival and also limited the size of the gathering. We have also alerted all the residents against Covid-19 as most of them work in large offices. Our focus is on maintaining strictest hygiene, especially at handrails along staircases and the lift areas. Besides, after playing Holi, the revellers discarded all the clothes they wore during the celebration,” he said.

Wakdewadi resident Harshita Sanghvi said, “It did not feel like Holi at all this year as there were hardly any celebrations. We did not even see people playing on the streets either.”

City resident Diksha Kini, currently in Bengaluru, said the celebrations remained low-key even there. “In fact, we had notices put up in the housing society asking people to avoid chemical colours. The notices urged people to use turmeric and beetroot water instead of artificial colours.”

According to restaurateurs from the city, several events were called for hosting Holi events. The Mills, for example, had announced Holi celebrations but cancelled the event a day in advance due to lack of permission. A partner at a restaurant at The Mills said, “We have not even arranged for a private party on our premises.”

President of Pune Restaurants and Hoteliers Association (PRAHA), Ganesh Shetty said the Pune police had cancelled all Holi party permissions in light of the Covid-19 scare.

Pune police commissioner K Venkatesham said several establishments had pro-actively called off their Holi events. “We saw muted Holi celebrations this year. The enthusiasm was lower due to coronavirus scare. Most establishments cancelled their events on their own,” he said.

Title: Day temperature slides in Pune, weather gets cooler
Content:
Partly cloudy sky over Yerawada on Tuesday

PUNE: It was a cool Holi for residents on Tuesday, as day temperature took a plunge, with mercury slipping by over 2 degrees to 30.6°C in Shivajinagar.

In Lohegaon, day temperature dropped slightly to 33.1°C, from Monday’s 34.7°C.

Shivajinagar’s day temperature was almost as low as Mumbai on Tuesday, where Colaba and Santacruz recorded 30.4°C and 30.5°C respectively. Day temperatures are usually lower in coastal locations than inland places, due to the influence of cool sea winds.

During the next two days, day temperatures in Pune are likely to range from 32-34°C, while night temperature may increase to 17°C, as per IMD forecast. On Tuesday, the minimum temperature in Shivajinagar was 15.5°C and 17.5°C in Lohegaon.

A senior scientist at the India Meteorological Department (IMD), Pune, said Madhya Maharashtra, including Pune, is currently under the influence of moderate westerly winds. “This, in association with a cyclonic circulation as well as a troughline is keeping temperatures lower than normal because they are also dragging moisture, which is causing partly cloudy skies during the day,” he said.

Partly cloudy skies during the day hinder the passage of solar insolation to the earth’s surface. This causes a drop in day temperatures.

“Partly cloudy sky conditions are expected to continue over Pune city and district till March 12,” the scientist explained.

Title: 3 men murdered in 12 hours in separate incidents, 4 arrested
Content:
New Delhi: Three murders were reported from east, northeast and northwest Delhi in a span of 12 hours . Police said that these were not crime-related murders and personal enmity and illicit affair were the motives behind the murders. The accused were arrested in two cases .

In New Usmanpur, a man murdered his relative, Kiran Pal, after playing Holi with him. At 3pm on Tuesday, Mithun came to meet Pal, applied colours on him and shot him dead, police said. Pal’s friend Jai was also injured in the firing. Mithun fled after the murder but was arrested later. Cops said that Mithun owed Rs 3.5 lakh to Pal in connection with a chit fund scheme. Pal had been demanding the money.

In Ghazipur, Raj Kumar was beaten to death by the husband of a woman he had an affair with. The accused was identified as Sachin. Police have also arrested Sachin’s friend, Vijay, and the woman, Jyoti, for their involvement in the crime. Kumar, police said, had made some objectionable videos of Jyoti and was blackmailing her after she began to distance herself from him. Jyoti then told Sachin everything.

On Monday night, Jyoti called Kumar to meet her at an under-construction building. When Kumar reached there, Sachin and Vijay allegedly beat him to death with sticks. Cops arrested the trio after scanning Pal’s call records.

Meanwhile, on Tuesday night, police were alerted about the murder of a man who had been assaulted and stabbed to death. The body was found on the railway tracks in Wazirpur Industrial Area. The deceased, Neeraj, had gone to the house of Vinod and demanded the money he had won in the gambling match organised by Vinod. An argument broke out after which Vinod and his friends, Suraj, Monu and Dilshad killed Neeraj. Their common friend, Rahul, tried to save Neeraj but failed. He, too, was injured.

In another incident reported from Geeta Colony, a man named Sujit was shot at by two men. He was admitted to a hospital for treatment.

Title: Cinemas to remain shut till Mar 31
Content:
Thiruvananthapuram: With the state government putting in place strict preventive measures following 14 confirmed coronavirus cases and over 1,000 persons under observation, movie theatres in the state will be closed from Wednesday. Office bearers of collectives of producers , distributors and exhibitors made the decision in an emergency meeting convened in Ernakulam on Tuesday.

“We are complying with the recommendation of the state government. Theatres are places where people gather in large numbers and when there are regulations being adopted to avoid such convergences, we think it’s best to shut down theatres for the time being,” said M Ranjith, president of the producers’ association.

The shutdown would affect the release of films such as the Tovino Thomas-starrer ‘Kilometres and Kilometres’ and the much-awaited ‘Marakkar: Arabikadalinte Simham’, directed by Priyadarshan. M C Bobby, secretary of the Film Exhibitors United Organisation of Kerala (FEUOK) said a review meeting will be held on March 16.

“At present, our priority is to prevent spread of the disease and the only possible way is to stop screenings. We will co-operate with every direction of the state government to keep this disease under check. Besides, the disease is being reported even in other countries, which also affects worldwide releases,” said Bobby.

Over 220 release centres and 600 screens, including multiplex screens, in the state will remain shut from Wednesday. While the decision is to keep theatres closed till March 31, there would be a review depending upon the status of disease control, the office bearers said.

Meanwhile, the forest department has banned visitor entry to all eco-tourism destinations and national parks in the state till March 31.

According to an official statement issued by PCCF and chief wildlife warden Surendra Kumar, the ban will be applicable to all programmes within forests, including nature camps. CWW has also directed wildlife wardens and DFOs (divisional forest officers) across the state to maintain high alert and take precautionary measures against the spread of Covid-19.

In Idukki district, CWW has directed the closure of all tourism programmes in Periyar Tiger Reserve (PTR) till the end of this month. The district collector also issued a separate order to stop boating activity in Thekkady. Silpa V Kumar, deputy director (Project Tiger) Periyar East division Thekkady, called off all community-based eco-tourism programmes, boating, tourist accommodations, Gavi safari and nature camps in PTR, besides Eravikulam National Park till March 31.

A statement issued by the assistant conservator of forests in charge of the Nature Study Centre, Kalady said the ban till March 31 will be applicable to various tourism centres including Kaprikkadu Abhayaranyam, Paanamkuzhi, Nedumbarachira, Nedumbassery Suvarnodhyanam and Ernakulam Mangalavanam.

Title: Covid-19 scare: Hand sanitizers arrive, but many substandard
Content:
AFP photo used for representational purpose only

MADURAI: The Covid-19 scare has brought hand sanitizers, which were not available in pharmacies and departmental stores early this week, back to the shelves of even small shops in plenty now. While they sell at twice the normal rate, indications are that they could be substandard duplicate products.

Parvathy, a homemaker in Anna Nagar, said she found that none of the shops in her area had hand sanitizers when she looked to purchase it in bulk for her entire family. ``So I bought two bottles of dettol handwash and gave my number to the pharmacist to call me as soon as he got a fresh stock of sanitizers,’’ she said. Many others too could not find sanitizers in any store. A shop in Anna Nagar called her up on Monday to inform her of stock arrival but told her that she would have to hurry as they were selling like hot cakes.

The price of a 55 ml bottle of sanitizer from company called PSK stated that it contained 95% ethyl alcohol, but there was no price tag on it. ``It is usually Rs 100, but now we are giving it for Rs 55 to our regular customers,’’ said the shopkeeper adding that he had kept aside bottles to supply only to known customers. However, there was no evidence that it contained alcohol, as it did not have that cooling effect that a high alcohol-containing sanitizer usually has, she said.

Many such unbranded products claiming to have alcohol content flew off the shelves on Tuesday also. Some cottage industries are now exploring ways of making sanitizers, ``It is just aloe vera, alcohol, a perfume, and two other ingredients, and I know how to do it,’’ said Satish of Thirupalai. ``If you want branded products, you can purchase online, but as of now hand sanitizers are not available even on Amazon. If you order a bottle, it takes it to the wishlist,’’ said S Suresh of Vilangudi.

Assistant director of drugs control, Madurai, N C Ravichandran said they were monitoring the availability of sanitizers and masks in Madurai, but there were sufficient stocks now. If any complaints of duplicate products were brought to their notice they would act on it. He said the general public should take precautions like washing hands regularly with soap and water. “It is the vulnerable population including medical staff and practitioners who have to use alcohol-based sanitizers,’’ he said.

Title: Cop awarded for fighting off gang alone in southeast Delhi
Content:
Top cop S N Shrivastava felicitated ASI Faiyaz Ahmed for his brave act

NEW DELHI: There was high drama in southeast Delhi’s Govindpuri last week when four criminals attacked a head constable after he flagged them down. The gang, led by notorious robber Deepak alias Deepu Nepali, attacked the policemen, ASI Faiyaz Ahmed , with his khukri.

Ahmed, however, did not retreat and grappled with them. Somehow he managed to whip out his service pistol and opened fire at the men, which forced them to back off and flee.

Ahmed was rushed to a hospital and given treatment. On Wednesday, Delhi Police commissioner S N Shrivastava felicitated Ahmed for his brave act.

A few months ago, a gang had committed an armed robbery at a grocery store and fled with Rs 1 lakh and other goods. Ahmed was investigating the case and had been trailing Deepak and his associates for a while. “On March 7, Ahmed received a tip-off about Deepak planning another crime in the area. He rushed to the site and found him and four others standing at the corner of a lane. When the ASI asked the men to surrender, they attacked him before fleeing from the spot,” DCP (South East) R P Meena said.

However, a team comprising inspector Satish Rana tracked the accused to somewhere near Nepal border. Since the border picket near Sanauli was cordoned, Deepak gave up on his plan and returned to Delhi. “He had come to Navjivan camp to collect money from his friends but was nabbed,” said an officer.

Deepak worked as a driver but took to crime for big money. Cops are looking for his associates.

Title: Activist to move Madras high court for damaging temple land for bull taming sport
Content:
Madras high court

SALEM: An activist has petitioned the chief minister’s special cell, seeking action against district collector S A Raman and Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowment (HR&CE) department officials for allowing villagers of Ulipuram to conduct jallikattu on a temple land, without obtaining permission from the HR&CE commissioner.

In his petition, A Radhakrishnan said the villagers have been preparing to conduct the bull taming sport on Wednesday (March 11) and that the land chosen for the event belonged to Vinayakar temple in the locality.

He said the villagers had approached the district administration, seeking permission to conduct jallikattu and that the collector had given nod on Monday after inspecting the elaborate arrangements that they had made for the event.

Radhakrishnan said the villagers were yet to get any permission from the HR&CE department. “They should get permission from the HR&CE commissioner as they are planning to conduct the event on temple land, which they have already damaged to erect stage and galleries.”

When contacted, A Natarajan, HR&CE joint commissioner (incharge), Salem zone, said neither the villagers nor the department had informed him about the event. “I will check with local HR&CE officials.”

Meanwhile, the collector said there was nothing wrong in conducting such events on temple land. “HR&CE commissioner could give his consent even on the day of the event. There is nothing wrong in carrying out preparations for the event before getting his consent. The district administration would ensure that the villagers carry out repair works after the event.”

Radhakrishnan, however, said he would move the Madras high court , seeking action against the district collector and HR&CE officials for damaging the temple land.

Title: Dist collector holds meeting with Muslims
Content:
Coimbatore: To quell the continuing tension in the city, district collector K Rajamani held a peace committee meeting with members of Federation of Coimbatore District All Jamaath and Islamic Federation at the collectorate on Tuesday night.

Speaking to reporters after the meeting, coordinator of the federation Raja Hussain said, “Muslims are being continuously attacked. We demanded the district collector to take action against Hindu Munnani functionaries involved in the attacks.”

“As many as eight Muslims were attacked and a petrol bomb hurled at a mosque near Ganapathy by Hindu Munnani and other Hindu outfits to create violence in the city. We demanded the collector to provide enough protection to Muslims and all mosques in the district,” Raja Hussain said.

He said Coimbatore is an economic zone and its industrial sectors should not be affected. “The district collector promised us that he would take action against those who are disturbing the peace and communal harmony. He also promised us to maintain peace in Coimbatore. We demand the immediate arrest of those involved in the assault of SDPI district secretary Mohammed Iqbal and party member Shajahan at Patel Road in Ram Nagar. The gang raised slogans like Jai Sriram, Jai Kali and Om Kali while attacking the SDPI functionaries.” tnn

Title: Tamil Nadu: 18 people held for kidnapping intercaste couple in Kolathur
Content:
Representative image

SALEM: At least 18 people were arrested on Tuesday evening for kidnapping an intercaste couple, who got married at the Periyar Padipakam in Kolathur on Monday.

According to a police officer attached to Kolathur police station, P Selvan and J Elamathi were colleagues and in love. “They met at a private firm near Bhavani here, where they are employed. They fell in love and wished to get married.”

A member of Dravida Viduthalai Kazhagam (DMK), Selvan is a scheduled caste, while Elamathi is a vanniyar. On Monday, the couple eloped and got married at the Periyar Padipakam in Kolathur.

On Monday night, a gang attacked Eswaran, a DMK functionary who solemnized the couple’s marriage, and kidnapped him. The gang also traced the couple, kidnapped the groom and bride in two separate cars the same night.

“Eswaran and Selvan managed to escape from the gang in the early hours of Tuesday and lodged a complaint with the Kolathur police,” the official said. District superintendent of police Deepa Ganigar and other police officials subsequently launched a probe into the issue.

“We have arrested 18 people and registered a case under various sections of SC/ST Act. We have sent a police team to Erode to trace the woman,” the superintendent of police said.

Title: Postal department plans to popularize its app
Content:
The system was launched more than a year ago

COIMBATORE: With required infrastructure in place, the Coimbatore circle of the postal department plans to popularize an app called the India Post Payments Bank (IPPB) among its postal bank account holders.

This app like Google Pay or Paytm allows us to send and receive money from people and pay utility bills. But the crucial difference is that this app also acts like a mobile ATM. People can withdraw and deposit money from their doorstep—homes or offices—via postmen . The system was launched more than a year ago.

“We are specifically targeting college students and people in rural areas, who probably have low balance accounts and do not have an ATM machine within walking distance,” said senior superintendent of post offices, Coimbatore division, Sudhir Gopal Jakhere.

“The IPPB even allows for zero balance and brings the ATM system to their hostels and places of work or houses,” he added.

How does your postman become a mobile ATM? Nearly 460 postmen and Gramin Dakh Sevaks in the district have been given IPPB hand-held devices. When a postman visits an account holder’s house or office, he can accept deposits and will be carrying a maximum of Rs 5,000 in cash for the account holder to make withdrawals too. “People who need to withdraw more cash can call 155299 and inform them. The postman will then come to your home or office with more cash,” an official said. “Currently, postmen are only accepting deposits and not carrying cash for withdrawals, but we will start that facility soon,” he said.

The IPPB has 4,222 account holders, which is a small fraction of the 10-lakh postal savings bank account holders in the circle. “We plan to start increasing the number of account holders first among the existing postal savings bank account holders and bring in new accounts,” Jakhere said.

“This bank makes holding an account with the postal department attractive, because they don’t need to stand in queues in post offices anymore for cash deposits or withdrawals or visit our ATMs for the same,” he said.

People who want to access the app need to open an India Post Payment Bank account, which in turn can be done only if you have postal savings bank account. Both will be instantly linked along with the holder’s Aadhar card details too. They also get a QR code when they open an account, which is said to be more secure than a credit or debit card. “When the postman arrives at your doorstep, you can either scan your QR code in his device or give your Aadhar number, to make a cash deposit or withdrawal. There are no charges for most of the transaction. You can also deposit money for recurring deposits in postal savings schemes or to pay bills through this app, like Paytm or Google Pay,” Jakhere said.

People interested in opening accounts can call 04222301224 or 9787488203.

Title: TDB urges devotees to put off Sabarimala pilgrimage
Content:
Thiruvananthapuram: Travancore Devaswom Board ( TDB ), in wake of Covid-19 threat, has urged devotees to postpone their pilgrimage to Sabarimala when the hill shrine remains open for Meenam month poojas from March 13 to 18.

The board, which assessed the situation at its meeting held here on Tuesday, also directed the temples under its jurisdiction to cancel all festivals, processions and other events including cultural programmes ‘which are likely to attract a large number of people’, and to conduct only rituals which are unavoidable.

“In line with the precautionary measures being initiated by the state government to check spread of Covid-19, we urge devotees not to come for darshan when Sabarimala temple opens for monthly pooja on Friday,” TDB president N Vasu told reporters after the meeting. He, however, said the board was not planning to use force to deter devotees.

“We don’t think such extreme measures would be required as we expect devotees to cooperate and postpone their pilgrimage. Only poojas and usual rituals will be conducted by priests and those assigned for that, which do not require the presence of devotees or TDB employees or those from other departments on special duty. Appam and aravana counters will remain closed,” Vasu said.

TDB will also make an announcement in this regard in local television channels in southern states, from where a large number of devotees would have already planned their Sabarimala darshan this month, he said.

“We also hope the state government will ask their counterparts in neighbouring states to discourage devotees from making the pilgrimage this month,” Vasu said.

He, however, said the board was yet to take a decision on imposing similar restrictions during the Painkuni Uthram festival in Sabarimala scheduled for the last week of the month.

Title: When Karthiyayani Amma met Bhageerathi Amma
Content:
Kollam: Karthiyayani Amma (96) of Alappuzha who shared the Nari Shakti Puraskar with Bhageerathi Amma (105), the world’s senior most student from Prakkulam, Kollam , met at the latter’s residence on Wednesday. Karthiyayani Amma was on her way back home after receiving the Nari Shakti award from the President at a function held at the Rashtrapathi Bhavan on Women’s Day.

Arriving in Kollam, she went directly to the district collector’s office and along with him, she went to visit Bhageerathi Amma who skipped the award ceremony owing to her advanced age. Karthiyayani Amma shared her experience of receiving the award from the President and about her meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Bhageerathi Amma also keenly inquired about the journey and examined Karthiyayani Amma’s citation.

Karthiyayani Amma became a sensation in the August function of the Prime Minister’s meeting with achievers from various fields by announcing her intention to attain computer literacy. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had also commended their feats in his monthly Mann ki Baat.

Bhageerathi Amma’s children Thulasidharan Pillai, Thankamani Amma; Karthiyayani Amma’s daughter Ammini, literacy mission Kollam district co-coordinator Pradeep Kumar, were among others to witness the rare meeting.

Title: Covid-19 scare: Trichy hotels told to screen tourists with infrared gun
Content:
Picture used for representational purpose only

TRICHY: In the wake of Covid-19 threat, food safety and drug administration department has advised major hotels in the city to conduct thermometer gun screening on foreign tourists. It is also planning to put up posters displaying the methods of hand washing in all the restaurants.

Designated officer of food safety and drug administration department Dr R Chithra said advisories have been issued to more than 10 hotels in the city to keep infrared gun for checking the temperature of foreign tourists staying in their hotels. “The practice has been advised for the past one week and all hotels are complying with our instruction. It can be checked by anyone with the gun. In case of escalation of temperature, they should inform the public health department and health officials will conduct proper examination of the person as per protocol,” Dr Chithra told TOI.

She said they have not received any communication from the hotels on any symptomatic patients. The department has also turned its focus on restaurants in the district and prepared a pamphlet with pictorial explanation of hand washing. The restaurants will be asked to display it in full view of customers. Trichy City Corporation had already advised all restaurants to keep either hand washing liquid or soap near the wash room for customers to maintain hand hygiene.

Trichy being a connecting point to several districts because of the presence of international airport with flights to Singapore, Malaysia, Sri Lanka, Dubai and Sharjah, inbound passengers from foreign countries are being screened from January 28. All passengers have been put through mandatory screening by the team of doctors of public health department and medical officers of the Airports Authority of India. A public health department official said that about 35,000 passengers were screened at Trichy airport till Monday. Of them, about 1,200 passengers had symptoms of fever and cough. Since they were residents of other districts, the public health department of these districts were intimated about their arrival for necessary follow-up for quarantine.

In Trichy district, public health department officials have been monitoring 56 passengers as on Monday. Several passengers who were home-quarantined and tested have recovered during the quarantine period. At the isolation ward in Mahatma Gandhi memorial government hospital (MGMGH), a 35-year-old man who had a travel history for Haj has been admitted following a referral from a private hospital with symptoms like cough and fever. The doctors said he was not showing any symptoms of Covid-19.

Title: Puducherry: 41-year-old man gets 25 years' rigorous imprisonment for raping daughter
Content:
Representative image

KARAIKAL: A 41-year-old man was sentenced to 25 years rigorous imprisonment by the Karaikal district-cum-sessions court for sexually assaulting his nine-year-old daughter in Puducherry.

Judge S Karthikeyan directed the government to provide a compensation of Rs 4 lakh to the victim besides slapping a fine of Rs 10,000 on the convict.

Special public prosecutor J Senthilraghavan said the man sexually assaulted his daughter when she was alone at their home. The victim’s mother used to leave for work early in the morning and return home only after the girl left for school. Her father took advantage of it and sexually assaulted her. He also threatened her with dire consequences if she revealed it to anyone.

The issue came to light when the minor complained of severe pain in her private parts to her mother. Her mother also found stains of blood in the girl’s inner garments and in the washroom. When pressed, the minor narrated the ordeal she had suffered at the hands of her father. Her shocked mother lodged a complaint with police against her husband. The man was booked under Section 6 (punishment for aggravated penetrative sexual assault ) of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (Pocso) Act, 2012, and Section 506 (ii) (criminal intimidation) of the IPC on October 8 last year. He was arrested and lodged in prison.

Police subjected the girl to medical examinations and the tests confirmed the charges of sexual assault. The Karaikal court concluded the trial in five months and convicted her father.

Title: Custody of five rape accused extended
Content:
Representative image

COIMBATORE: The judicial custody of five accused in the Pollachi rape case has been extended till March 24.

Earlier on Tuesday morning, the accused, who were lodged at the Salem central prison, were produced before the district mahila court.

The CBI has already filed a preliminary chargesheet and copies of it were handed over to the accused. The framing of charges against the five is expected to begin soon.

The five accused were allegedly involved in raping a college student at a farmhouse near Anamalai last year. They also video recorded the act and were using the footage to blackmail and threaten the student. It later emerged that the five accused were also allegedly kidnapped or lured several girls and raped them. They also video recorded the sexual assaults to harass and blackmail the girls for money.

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

Title: Greet people the Indian way to stay safe from coronavirus: Telangana governor Tamilisai Soundararajan
Content:
Tamilisai Soundararajan

TRICHY: While saying that the custom of shaking hands to greet each other makes one prone to contracting Covid-19, Telangana governor Tamilisai Soundararajan said that it was time to realise the value of the Indian tradition. The Indian way of greeting people with folded hands has proved to be the safest way, she said.

Speaking after inaugurating the new building at Santhanam Vidhyalaya Senior Secondary School in Trichy , she said it was time that people shunned western practices.

She said that as the state health minister C Vijaya Baskar has said the situation in the state was not alarming and there was no need not to panic. However, one has to take precautions to stay safe from Covid-19.

Tamilasai said she is the youngest among incumbent governors in the country, she said hard work and honesty were the two mantras to reach greater heights.

Later in the day while addressing over 500 women at an event at Femina Hotel, she asked them to face challenges in life without succumbing to pressure.

Tamilisai also visited the Sri Ranaganathaswamy temple, Srirangam and later travelled to Theni in the evening for attending another function.

Title: Petrol Bomb Attack in Coimbatore: Petrol bomb hurled at Hindu Munnani office
Content:
outside the Hindu Munnani office at Kattoor

COIMBATORE: Tension gripped the city after miscreants hurled a petrol bomb at Hindu Munnani office at Kattoor in the early hours of Tuesday and a seven-member gang assaulted a district secretary of SDPI at Ram Nagar in the evening.

When a functionary of Hindu Munnani opened the main gate of outfit’s head office on Range Konar Street at Kattoor around 10.45am on Tuesday, he found broken bottles with a wick. Immediately, he alerted state executive committee member Guna who rushed to the office along with HM cadres and informed police.

“Some miscreants had hurled petrol bomb at our office to create violence and disturb the peace. Our district secretary Anand was attacked by anti-elements and extremists. But police have not arrested any accused in the case so far. Police have asked us to remain calm and assured to arrest the culprits,” Guna said. He accused the state government and higher officials in the police department of not allowing the city police to take stringent action against miscreants.

“These kinds of small incidents only led to violence in 1997-98 in the city. Police should prevent such incidents. These incidents also show the inefficiency of intelligence wing of the police,” Guna said.

Hindu Munnani state president Kadeswara C Subramaniam announced a protest at Tatabad at 4pm on Wednesday to condemn the attack on Hindu Munnani functionaries and office. Alleging that it was an intelligence failure to prevent the attack on his outfit’s office, Subramaniam said the city police are showing reluctance to act against miscreants.

Deputy commissioner of police (law & order) L Balaji Saravanan, other police officials and forensic experts visited the Hindu Munnani office and conducted inquiry. Police have formed special teams to nab the miscreants.

Meanwhile, around 3.30pm, a seven-member gang assualted Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) district secretary Mohammed Iqbal while he was on way to a bakery from his shop at Ram Nagar by walk.

Iqbal suffered a cut injury on his head in the attack. He was taken to a private hospital and later shifted to the Coimbatore Medical College and Hospital (CMCH) where he is undergoing treatment. Iqbal lodged a complaint with the Kattoor police.

Functionaries of SDPI demanded the city police to take action against those who assaulted Iqbal.

City police commissioner Sumit Sharan told reporters that the situation was under control. “We have deployed 1,000 police personnel and two companies of Rapid Action Force (RAF) in the city. So far, we have solved three cases and our special teams are working round-the-clock to arrest the miscreants who pelted petrol bomb at Hindu Munnani office and assualted SDPI district secretary,” Sumit Sharan said.

Besides these two, the city also witnessed two more incidents of stone pelting and vandalizing an auto on Monday night and in the early hours of Tuesday respectively.

Around 10.30pm on Monday, two motorcycle-borne miscreants pelted stones at the auto of Kadar Sheriff, 32, near Puttuuvikki bridge while he was on his way back home at Thiruvalluvar Nagar in Kuniyamuthur. The windshield of the auto was damaged in the attack. Kadar sheriff lodged a complaint with the Kuniyamuthur police.

In another incident, unidentified miscreants broke the windshield of an auto belonging to K Karthik, 31, a BJP cadre, around 3am on Tuesday at Ganga Nagar in Kuniyamuthur. The auto was parked outside Karthik’s house. Karthik lodged a complaint with the Kuniyamuthur police .

Two held for attack on mosque

Police on Tuesday arrested a Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) member and a BJP worker for hurling a petrol bomb at a mosque near Ganapathy here on February 5.

The accused, K Pandi alias Sadaiyandi, 41, of Periyasamy Layout at Rathinapuri, and V Akil, 23 of Rathinapuri, were detained during a vehicle check at Chinnavedampatti by Sarvanampatti police inspector V Selvaraj and his team around 6am.

On interrogation, Pandi and Akil confessed to hurling the petrol bomb at Hidayathul Sunnath Jamaath mosque at Vedambal Nagar near Ganapathy. Akil is a member of VHP and Pandi is a member BJP. The duo told police that they hurled the petrol bomb as a retaliation for the attack on Hindu Munnani district secretary Anand.

Title: Introduce Tamil in entry level classes in KV, say parents
Content:
Trichy: Like any other city, many parents in Trichy are gearing up to try their luck at admission in Kendriya Vidyalayas at the entry level for their wards in the coming academic year. While affordable fees and good education standards have been attracting most parents to these schools, there has been a demand from a section of parents to teach Tamil language from the entry level in these schools.

There are three central schools in the district - one each in Ordnance Factory Tiruchirappalli (OFT) and Heavy Alloy Penetrator Project (HAPP) and another school in Ponmalai. As the two language policy is followed in these centrally funded schools, the medium of instruction is either Hindi or English.

“We are not against Hindi but learning mother tongue is essential for our children,” said a parent who has one of her child going to Ponmalai central school.

“We want quality education and that is ensured in the school, but that is happening at the cost of mother tongue. We can teach her Tamil by sending her for tuition but that may not be equal to learning in a school atmosphere,” said the parent.

A Marappan, former principal of KV at OFT, said that his daughter finds at a disadvantage for not having studied Tamil as it is essential to write competitive examination conducted by the state. During his tenure as principal, he had hired an ad hoc teacher to teach Tamil for interested students above Class V. But it is not taught for students at the entry level.

“There is a provision to hire a teacher to teach additional language on an ad hoc basis for students above Class V. But that largely depends on the interest of the incumbent principal,” said another former principal V Natarajan.

It may not be possible to introduce additional language at the entry level as it would be a burden for children to learn three languages, he added.

“While Hindi and Sanskrit are compulsory for students till class VIII apart from English, addition of another language will certainly be a burden for them,” said another teacher from KV Ponmalai. “After class VIII, they can choose either Hindi or Sanskrit. A hobby language, either Tamil or German, is compulsory but that would not reflect in the report card as there are no formal examination for the language,” she said.

Title: Beheaded body of man found in Erode
Content:
Representative image

ERODE: A body of a 24-year-old man and his severed head were found at Lakshmi Nagar in Erode on Monday night.

Police identified the deceased as C Prithiviraj, 24, of Narayan Nagar in Salem. He was working in a dyeing unit in Erode.

“Prithiviraj was last seen by a few residents of Odaipallam when he quarreling with four unidentified people. They were drinking together. The residents told them to go away from the area,” a police officer attached to the Veerapanchatram police station said.

“In a few minutes, some residents found Prithiviraj body and his severed head near the Odaipallam canal,” the officer said.

After being informed around 12am on Tuesday, police reached the spot and initiated an inquiry. They retrieved the body and the head and sent them to the government hospital for postmortem.

“We are trying to trace the identities of the four people who were consuming alcohol with the deceased,” the police officer said.

Police have registered a case and further inquiry is on.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Three stolen metal idols of temple recovered, four held
Content:
Representative image

THANJAVUR: Police recovered three metal idols and a few silver utensils stolen from Srinivasa Perumal temple at Thirupurambiam near Kumbakonam in Thanjavur district and arrested four people, including a woman, in the early hours of Tuesday.

Swamimalai police arrested K Ramalingam, 46, his wife Rasathi, 37, and son R Kamal Raj from Kamaraj Nagar in Kumbakonam as well as their accomplice G Melvin Sahayaraj, 39, from Pottuvachavadi in this regard. The retrieved three idols were a two-and-a-half-foot-tall Srinivasa Perumal idol, a half-foot Padmavathi Thayar idol and a half-foot Viswaksenar idol besides four silver utensils.

Acting on a tip, police recovered the valuables from near a pond in Thanjavur. Being run by a group of people, Srinivasa Perumal temple was targeted by the gang on the night of February 10. Ramalingam was the mastermind of the crime while his wife was an accomplice. The police said that Kamal Raj and Melvin Sahayaraj broke open the temple doors and lifted the valuables.

DSP Jeyachandran said Ramalingam was an offender in a separate case of idol theft in another district. The idols could be a century old as the first consecration was held in 1912.

Title: My daughter does not have a single friend in her dance class
Content: Hello. Thank you for writing to us. First things first, I really appreciate the fact that you are encouraging your daughter to take up certain hobbies and develop skills. However, having said that not having made any friends for the past one year despite you mentioning the fact that she's quite a friendly kid seems quite unnatural.I would suggest you to find out that if at all she enjoys dancing and attending class. Slowly start a conversation in a natural format about her particular batch of dance class and how she feels about her peers in that class. There might be a possibility that she might not have clicked with anyone in that class or she doesn't like taking dance classes altogether.It might be that she is dealing with some of her own personal issues which might have pumped her to be quiet in class altogether.While having a conversation just note her reactions which will give you further details as to how she feels about her environment and she herself in the class .I hope this helps. If you want to discuss things further, feel free to contact us.Dr Rachna Khanna Singh is HOD - Holistic Medicine & Psychology (Counselling) - Artemis Hospital, Gurgaon, Director - The Mind & Wellness Clinic, New Delhi and Director - NGO ServeSamman

Title: SEC orders webcast of local body election proceedings
Content:
Visakhapatnam: Responding to security concerns, the Visakhapatnam district administration has decided to webcast election day proceedings from as many polling stations as possible during the upcoming local body elections.

Speaking to the media, district collector V Vinay Chand said on Tuesday that the state election commission has directed the administration to webcast proceedings at election booths.

“We will review the feasibility of procuring web-cameras or may use laptops,” Chand informed. Officials said that students from the city’s many engineering colleges may also be roped in for help.

With regard to election paraphernalia, the district collector said that 1,712 polling stations will be set up for elections within the limits of the Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation (GVMC). Every polling station will have a maximum of 1,200 voters, he informed.

The district collector further said, “A total of 10,600 polling personnel will be deployed across the city for the GVMC polls. The first stage of randomisation of polling personnel is over.”

“This will be followed by the formation of polling teams with one presiding officer, one assistant presiding officer and three polling personnel for each station in the subsequent stages of randomisation,” the collector said while adding that personnel won’t have any clue about the station assigned to them till March 22, March 23 being the day of election.

Vinay Chand added that 15 nodal officers will be appointed to take care of election duties including maintenance of model code of conduct, management of polling personnel, training and material procurement.

“Flying squads and static surveillance teams will ensure strict enforcement of the model code of conduct in the city. Zonal officers will be responsible for election proceedings in respective zones. We will send proposals to the state government to appoint zonal officers, who will be conferred with magisterial powers,” the collector said.

When the media asked him about the on-going case on merger of new villages, the district collector said that the administration has not received any interim order to stop or stay elections .

Meanwhile, a total of 303 nominations have been filed in Visakhapatnam district till Tuesday. On Tuesday itself, 264 nominations were filed. Of the 303 nominations— 29 are from BJP, 11 from CPI, 31 from CPI(M), 6 from Congress, 85 from TDP and 116 from YSRC. Jana Sena filed 18 nominations while 7 independent nominations were filed.

Title: 510 booths identified as sensitive
Content:
Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: The city police have identified around 510 polling stations as sensitive and hypersensitive. The deployment of police personnel on polling day will be done in accordance with the nature of the booths.

For hypersensitive polling stations, one head constable and four constables will be deployed. While for sensitive polling stations, one head constable and two constables will be deployed. In the case of normal polling stations, one or two cops will be deployed.

City police commissioner RK Meena said on Tuesday that the police have started registering bound-over cases against history-sheeters and cases against nearly 100 people were registered on Monday.

Meena added that the police would strictly implement the recently promulgated ordinance amending the AP Panchayat Raj Act.

“As per the ordinance, anyone found guilty of indulging in electoral malpractices such as distribution of liquor and cash would be disqualified and could also face a three-year jail term. We have also asked license holders to deposit their arms,” the police commissioner said.

Title: Will poll fever distract students appearing for Inter, Class 10 exams?
Content:
Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: The fever of the upcoming local body elections seems to taking a toll of the focus of students preparing for Intermediate and class 10 examinations soon.

The MPTC and ZPTC polls will be held on March 21 and counting will be taken up on March 24. For urban local bodies, polling will be held on March 23 and votes will be counted on March 27.

On the other hand, Intermediate examinations are going on, which will end on March 23. The class 10 exams will begin on March 11 and end on April 15.

This could affect preparations of a large section of students, according to a retired political science professor of Andhra University .

According to the professor, local body elections make greater noise than general or state elections. Since local body elections are contested within smaller constituencies, political parties often conduct door-to-door campaigns , he said.

“Local body elections and campaigns indirectly inject political fever in every household,” the professor said.

Moreover, teachers too will be too busy to help students in their last minute preparations as the government is going to send them on election duty, before which they will also have to undergo training sessions.

Speaking to TOI, a teacher who refused to be identified informed, “The government has announced training classes for election duty staff on March 16 and 20.”

Meanwhile, MVR Raju, professor of psychology at AU opined that in order to help students concentrate parents should refrain from discussing politics and elections at home and limit television timings. Film actors should also refrain from campaigns, Raju added.

Title: YSRC woos rivals to gain advantage
Content:
Visakhapatnam: Three former MLAs, including a minister, joined YSRC in the presence of party general secretary V Vijayasai Reddy.

Former Congress minister Pasupuleti Balaraju, who quit Jana Sena joined YSRC along with his daughter Darshini. Former Congress MLA Tynala Vijayakumar, who left YSRC for TDP before the general elections , returned to YSRC along with Jana Sena leader and former Congress MLA Ch. Venkataramayya.

Former Vuda chairman and MLA SK Rehman and wife Shirin Rehman had joined YSRC on Monday.

Considering that TDP has a presence in Greater Visakha region, YSRC is luring other party leaders to grab the mayor seat at any cost.

Drashini Balaraju will contest ZPTC elections in the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category from GK Veedhi in Visakha Agency. She is likely to be in the race for ZP chairperson seat as Visakhapatnam ZP is reserved for ST woman. Dadi Veerabhadra Rao, YSRC in-charge for local body elections and former MLC, said YSRC will win GVMC polls due to various welfare schemes introduced by the government. “By seeing these welfare activities several opposition leaders are joining YSRC,” he said.

When YSRC won 151 assembly seats, the city gave four seats to TDP. To offset this, YSRC general secretary Vijayasai Reddy is focusing on the city, said sources. Chief minister Y S Jaganmoan Reddy has instructed party leaders to induct any leader who comes forward to join YSRC, especially from the TDP ranks. “It seems that the CM has a plan to stymie TDP in the city,” sources said.

YSRC is likely to announce its first list of candidates with 50 names for GVMC elections on Wednesday.

Title: CPI(M) releases list of 21 candidates
Content: Visakhapatnam: CPI(M) released the first list of 21 candidates for GVMC elections on Tuesday. CPI(M) is contesting the elections with support of AAP, BSP and Lok Satta. Dr B Ganga Rao, city secretary of the party criticised the major political parties for allegedly trying to privatise public services tnn

Title: Coronavirus scare throws water on Visakhapatnam’s holi celebrations
Content:
Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: Scare of the novel coronavirus (Covid-19) took a toll on city’s Holi celebrations this year. While people did celebrate in the festival of colours, the numbers were far less than usual. Many schools and colleges also remained open.

Holi in Visakhapatnam is usually celebrated with Holi-bashes and rain dances on the Beach Road. Event managers plan grand programmes for over a week. In 2018, a Spain-style La Tomatina festival was also celebrated.

However, not this time. While people largely kept away from celebrations, the police did not give special permissions for events. Celebrations were largely limited to some hotels.

Speaking to TOI, Ch Adinarayana, ACP (traffic) said that the police did not notice large crowds celebrating this year. Generally, the police deploy special teams, “but this year we did not feel any pressure as there were no big crowds on the beach,” Adinarayana said.

K Rama Rao, the owner of a departmental store at Sivaji Park said that instead of buying colours and water guns, people are buying hand sanitizers and masks.

Meanwhile, Parvati, who sells eggs at the beach, said that while she sold over 500 eggs last year, this year she sold less than a hundred eggs.

Title: Thane bank staffer, six aides try to get loan on fake Rs 50 crore fixed deposit
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: A relationship manager with a private bank's mutual fund department and his six accomplices have been arrested for allegedly trying to secure a loan against a fake Rs 50-crore fixed deposit receipt.

The fraud came to light on Monday when the alleged mastermind, Manish Parmar (41), and four others -Agrel Nadar (36), Sukhat Panda (30), Vijay Janke (40) and Gautam Sharma (35), all from Mira Road and Bhayander-visited ICICI Bank's Andheri (E) branch to get an overdraft facility against the FD. But when Parmar, who was posing as the original account-holder-Upendranath Nimgada from Vijayawada in Andhra Pradesh-failed to provide details, the bank officials suspected something was amiss. The bank's vigilance department found that the FD receipt was a fake and the original account-holder had already encashed it on its maturity date.

The bank alerted the Andheri police, who arrested the five fraudsters. "Parmar led us to Pranav Gupta alias Dharmendra Kumar (29), who is employed with the bank's Bhayander branch; and Mohammed Shaikh, who had helped make the fake FD receipt. They were arrested on Tuesday," said senior inspector Vijay Belge. Zonal DCP Ankil Goyal said: "Gupta had provided the bank's watermark paper for the FD receipt."

On learning that there have been four similar attempts in the past, the police are verifying if the same gang was involved. A team, including inspector Shivaji Pawade and sub-inspector Anandrao Ghadge-are investigating if more bank staffers are involved in the crime. The seven accused have been booked under the relevant IPC sections for cheating, forgery and impersonation.

Title: Thane bank staffer, six aides try to get loan on fake Rs 50 crore fixed deposit
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: A relationship manager with a private bank's mutual fund department and his six accomplices have been arrested for allegedly trying to secure a loan against a fake Rs 50-crore fixed deposit receipt.

The fraud came to light on Monday when the alleged mastermind, Manish Parmar (41), and four others -Agrel Nadar (36), Sukhat Panda (30), Vijay Janke (40) and Gautam Sharma (35), all from Mira Road and Bhayander-visited ICICI Bank's Andheri (E) branch to get an overdraft facility against the FD. But when Parmar, who was posing as the original account-holder-Upendranath Nimgada from Vijayawada in Andhra Pradesh-failed to provide details, the bank officials suspected something was amiss. The bank's vigilance department found that the FD receipt was a fake and the original account-holder had already encashed it on its maturity date.

The bank alerted the Andheri police, who arrested the five fraudsters. "Parmar led us to Pranav Gupta alias Dharmendra Kumar (29), who is employed with the bank's Bhayander branch; and Mohammed Shaikh, who had helped make the fake FD receipt. They were arrested on Tuesday," said senior inspector Vijay Belge. Zonal DCP Ankil Goyal said: "Gupta had provided the bank's watermark paper for the FD receipt."

On learning that there have been four similar attempts in the past, the police are verifying if the same gang was involved. A team, including inspector Shivaji Pawade and sub-inspector Anandrao Ghadge-are investigating if more bank staffers are involved in the crime. The seven accused have been booked under the relevant IPC sections for cheating, forgery and impersonation.

Title: Session held on funding for women entrepreneurs
Content:
Visakhapatnam: The AP Chambers of Commerce and Industry organised an interactive session on ‘ Funding schemes for women entrepreneurs and women-led start-ups’ in Visakhapatnam recently. The aim of the session was to address issues surrounding access to funds and business skills of women entrepreneurs.

Speaking on the occasion, AS Ramayya, AGM of Small Scale Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) said that a number of government schemes exist to help Indian women start, build and grow businesses in an attempt to resolve social inequities.

Rammayya further said that in order to uplift women of scheduled caste and scheduled tribe communities, a 25% special credit linked capital subsidy scheme is being launched.

Srinu Appikonda, assistant director of MSME Development Institute said that the institute has started offering techno-managerial consultancy services to prospective and existing entrepreneurs apart from providing market-linkage facilities and conducting credit facilitation programmes.

Women entrepreneurs from various sectors and diverse backgrounds attended the session.

Title: Rare skin condition survivor now promotes ‘sustainable living’
Content:
Ankita Muwal

VISAKHAPATNAM: When 27-year-old Ankita Muwal was diagnosed with Hidradentitis Suppurativa (HS) — a rare skin condition that causes painful lumps under the skin, little did she know that her path to recovery will become an inspiration.

It was while she was working at a pharmaceutical firm in Hyderabad, that she first noticed the symptoms. Subsequently, her condition worsened. The pain became severe and she was unable to perform daily tasks.

The doctors she went to told her that HS, also called ‘acne inversa’, was incurable. The wounds started getting deeper and the pain began taking a toll on her mental health.

Speaking to TOI, Ankita said, “I tried all suitable medication, from allopathic to homeopathic. Some dermatologists prescribed antibiotics, steroids and some even prescribed harmful retinoids. At a point, I was also prescribed biologics which are not only extremely expensive, but also cause pain and come with side effects. I felt rejected hopeless and alone.”

However, the young woman has now managed to heal herself after educating herself on holistic health, fitness and nutrition. According to Ankita, it was this that helped her understand the basics of the body. “The deep, painful would and zits which seemed impossible to heal have healed miraculously,” she said.

According to Ankita, she was able to reverse this condition by adopting a ‘sustainable lifestyle’. Having transformed herself, Ankita is now on a mission to empower a thousand more people and help them follow a holistic lifestyle.

“I intend to educate people on lifestyle diseases through an e-learning platform by which people around the world can heal themselves. I am also creating a YouTube channel to create more awareness about HS,” Ankita said.

Title: sensex: Dalal Street may stabilise today if global markets remain in green
Content: MUMBAI: The stock market is expected to stabilise as it opens on Wednesday following a day’s break for Holi, and two days after the mayhem on Monday when the sensex recorded its worst ever single-session points drop, closing at a year-low level.Recovery in Asian markets and some steady trades in Europe, along with US markets expected to recover into positive territory, may calm the jittery nerves of Dalal Street investors on Wednesday morning, market players said. A stability for the market on a sustained basis, however, could be at least two-three months in the futures, they said.On Monday, the sensex — spooked by a global sell-off due to the spread of coronavirus and crashing crude oil prices — recorded a 1,942-point fall, its biggest ever, to close at 35,635. As a result, over Rs 7 lakh crore worth of investors’ wealth was wiped out in a single session. In addition to the twin impact of the deadly virus and sliding crude prices, D-Street also had to grapple with fears of financial instability in India due to the failure of Yes Bank, once the fourth largest private sector lender, that was put under RBI’s operative restrictions last week.On Tuesday, while the Indian markets were closed for trading, around the world markets were stable with mostly positive biases. Nikkei in Japan closed nearly 1% higher, while the Hang Seng in Hong Kong was up 1.4%. In Europe, UK’s FTSE managed to end flat at 0.1% down, while Germany’s Dax closed 1.4% lower.Across the Atlantic, the Dow Jones index, after an over 7% slide on Monday that also saw a 15-minute suspension of trade due to its hitting the lower circuit breaker, was up about a percent, while Ibovespa in Brazil, that lost over 12% on Monday, was up 3%.Market players here feel a bounce-back after a session of furious selling is due on Wednesday on D-Street with oil marketing companies, which stand to benefit from the crashing crude oil prices, leading the up-move. However, they warned that inventory losses of these companies could be substantial in the initial weeks unless they do not reduce petro product prices.In the bonds market, the action is expected to be around those issued by banks that are called additional tier-1 (AT1) and tier-2 papers. Last week, the RBI had decided to extinguish AT1 bonds issued by Yes Bank as part of the lender’s restructuring plan, which has hit several mutual funds, insurance companies, pension funds and high net worth individuals.
