Title: Coronavirus in Kerala: Kerala on a war footing as coronavirus cases rise to 14
Content:
People who have come from abroad are being taken ot isolation ward of Ernakulam government medical college.

KOCHI: Eight more novel coronavirus cases were confirmed in the state on Tuesday, taking the total number of infected to 14 as the government decided to impose severe restrictions, including closure of educational institutions and cinema houses till the monthend, to halt its further spread.

The infection was confirmed in parents of the three-year-old boy, who tested positive for the virus earlier, on Tuesday evening. They have also been quarantined at Ernakulam Medical College Hospital. Among the other new cases in the state, four are admitted in Kottayam and two in Pathanamthitta. These people had contracted the virus from the three persons who tested positive in Pathanamthitta earlier.

As many as 1,495 people are under observation in the state, of which 259 are admitted to various hospitals. A specially-convened cabinet meet on Tuesday decided to close down all educational institutions, barring medical education institutions, till March 31. No examinations will be conducted for Class I to VII.

CM Pinarayi Vijayan urged all religious institutions to organise festivals and rituals without mass gatherings.

Title: Mumbai man gets two years for illegal wall that fell, killing baby next door
Content:
Picture used for representational purpose only

MUMBAI: A Borivli resident was convicted and sentenced to two years rigorous imprisonment after an illegal construction in his house led to a wall collapse that killed his neighbour's three-year-old daughter in 2009.

Finding the accused, Sadhuram Pal (41), guilty, the magistrate said, "It is proved that without taking care of the lives of others, Pal was constructing his house due to which Jyoti lost her life."

Pal was found guilty under section 304 A of the Indian Penal Code which deals with causing death by negligence. The maximum sentence under this is two years imprisonment.

The deceased child's father, grandmother and uncle deposed, telling the court that fearing such an incident they had requested him to stop work. However, Pal did not pay heed and continued constructing the first floor which was unauthorised.

The child's father, Sanjay Rajbhar, and his family lived at Ganpat Patil Nagar. Rajbhar told the police that a common wall stood between his house and Pal's. He said that on August 20, 2009, around 1.30 pm, the wall collapsed and fell on the tin roof of his house. Rajbhar said that the roof collapsed and left his daughter, mother and brother injured. Jyoti was trapped under the debris. She was taken to hospital where she was pronounced dead. An FIR was lodged and the accused was arrested on August 27. The same day he was granted bail.

Content: Veena maestro Rajhesh Vaidhya will be performing 100 songs in 100 minutes commemorating the first year anniversary of his unique video concept on social media titled #DoYouHaveAMinute series.Rajhesh Vaidhya is one of the prominent musicians from India to have extensively toured and performed with legends around the world. Staying relevant and innovating new concepts coupled with immense practice, he continues to build his audience across the globe.The grand concert is happening on March 21 at Sir Mutha Venkatasubba Rao Concert Hall, Lady Andal School, Chennai from 6.30am onwards. The finesse in performing a song for a minute and blending into the next one with ease will be an amazing experience for he audience, the organisers of the event say.Vaidhya had, along with his band, set a record of playing 60 songs snippets on veena in 60 minutes in 2019. The title of the record, given by Asia Book of Records, was ‘Maximum song snippets played on a veena in an hour’.

Title: Afghanistan set to release 1,500 Taliban prisoners; US wants less violence
Content:
KABUL: After a series of delays, Afghan President Ashraf Ghani issued a decree early Wednesday promising to release 1,500 Taliban prisoners as a goodwill gesture to get intra-Afghan negotiations started, even though a deal signed by the United States and the Taliban calls for the release of up to 5,000 prisoners ahead of the much sought after negotiations.

There was no immediate response from the Taliban.

The decree went on to say the first round of 1,500 prisoners will be selected based on age, health and the length of their sentences already served. The released prisoners, who will be biometrically identified, will also have to give a written guarantee that they will not return to the battlefield.

The remaining 3,500 prisoners will be released after intra-Afghan negotiations begin and 500 will be released every two weeks providing the Taliban reduce violence on the battlefield.

However, even if the Taliban agree to start negotiations, Kabul's political turmoil and relentless bickering between Ghani and his main rival, Abdulllah Abdullah , who has also sworn himself in as Afghanistan 's president, have left Kabul struggling to come up with a united negotiating team.

Ghani's decree came as the US State Department issued a statement saying that the level of violence is "unacceptable," and that while the Taliban have stopped attacks against the US-led coalition forces and in Afghan cities, the violence in the countryside remains too high.

The statement also said Afghanistan's "presidential electoral crisis" — an apparent reference to the two inaugurations and political chaos — has delayed the establishment of a national negotiating team and the start of intra-Afghan talks, which were to begin on Tuesday in Oslo, Norway.

Despite the political chaos in Kabul and increased violence on the battlefield, the United States has started withdrawing its troops in keeping with the deal it signed on Feb. 29 with the Taliban. In the first phase, Washington will reduce its troops contingent to 8,600, down from the current 13,000.

If the Taliban adhere to their commitments to deny terrorists safe havens in Afghanistan, Washington will withdraw the remainder of its troops over 14 months, according to the agreement.

When it was signed, the US-Taliban deal was touted as Afghanistan's best chance at finding peace after 40 years of relentless war while offering the United States an exit after nearly 19 years and its longest war.

President Donald Trump has expressed increasing frustration with the Afghan government and its security forces' inability to police and manage their own affairs. But almost from the beginning the unraveling began as the Taliban returned to the battlefield and Afghanistan's politicians stepped up their feuding as Washington's Special Envoy Zalmay Khalilzad scrambled to find a way out of the impasse.

In the end, both Ghani and Abdullah declared themselves president. The United States and other international players attended Ghani's ceremony while urging both men to negotiate a single government.

Content:

One of the most awaited film is director Venkat Prabhu 's ' Maanaadu ' starring Silambarasan TR and Kalyani Priyadarshini in the lead. While the team had wrapped a schedule in Chennai recently, they have now flown to Hyderabad yesterday and the shooting is set to start today in the city.We had earlier reported that the team will be camping in Hyderabad for about 40 days and after that they will be shooting some portions in Coimbatore. The film bankrolled by Suresh Kamatchi under the banner V House Productions also has SA Chandrasekar, Bharathiraja, Karunakaran and Premji in important roles.Producer Suresh Kamatchi tweeted a selfie on their way to the location with the film's principal cast and crew members, including SJ Suryah, Karunakaran, Manoj P. Bharathiraja and Premgi.Touted to be an political-thriller, the film marks the the STR and Venkat Prabhu’s first collaboration in their long careers. Silambarasan TR is playing a muslim character in the film for the first time in his long career. He will be essaying the role of Abdul Khaaliq, the protagonist.

Title: yuvaa: What's Up, Campus? When students shared untold stories of their struggle
Content:
‘What if I am not treated with love, respect and empathy?’

‘Adjustments have been hard for me’

‘I became the ugly girl who had no friends’

‘It was my way of convincing my parents to allow me to sing’

“There is no greater agony than having an untold story still inside you,’” said one of the students in the audio-visual clip shown before a room full of students from different colleges of Pune who took part in the open mic hosted by Yuvaa 2.0, a content creating a platform for youngsters. The event, which saw co-founder narrate his battle with anxiety, followed by an open mic for students, saw many youngsters coming forward to shares stories that they had buried in their minds before.Co-founded by Nikhil Taneja , Yuvaa is a safe space for intimate conversations for college youngsters and it has travelled across 20 cities and 50 colleges in India. The idea is to engage, interact, share stories with the generation and listen to their take on mental health, gender, sexuality, sexual abuse, body shaming, bullying etc. In Pune, the initiative happened at four colleges - Symbiosis School for Symbiosis School of Sports Sciences , Symbiosis Centre for Media & Communication (SCMC), ISB&M College of Commerce, and Bharati Vidyapeeth College of Engineering (BVP).While the focus of the campaign is to create safe spaces for students, the Yuva team wants to create a support group with campuses. Talking of the same, Nikhil said, “A lot of students do not have a friend they can reach out to when in need, or to talk about their feelings, hence the process of building a community of youngsters is underway. We are aiming at building kindness clubs comprising students, teachers, and therapists and identifying kindness ambassadors from among students on campuses who will be responsible for leading a community where students will be able to discuss anything freely. The idea is to have a comfortable space within college premises that lets them express and provide help - emotional, psychological and professional - when needed.”While there were moments which got students overwhelmed with emotions, there were inspiring conversations as well. Ishita Sajwan, a sports management student from Symbiosis School of Sports Sciences, Lavale, came forward to share her battle with mental health issues. “I’m a little apprehensive right now. My parents and close friends are aware that I am suffering from anxiety and depression and seeking professional help over the last four years. I’m skeptical-what if I am not treated with love, respect and empathy? I’m fearing judgement because the people you study with are often unpredictable and you do not know how they'll react if they learn that you’re suffering from anxiety and depression. I am also struggling with my career,” she disclosed. Listening to her story, students lauded her for her courage.Mrinmai Nagvekar, another student from the same college, shared how the struggle to adjust to a new environment, caused anger issues with her and how she overcame those. “I’ve been a pampered child and the youngest in my batch, because of which, adjustments have always been harder for me,” said an emotional Mrimai, adding, “Many of my classmates called me Alice in Wonderland. This resulted in severe anger and stress-related issues and partial liver failure. I’ve worked on myself and no longer have anger issues, thanks to my friends. However, I’m still recovering from the liver ailment.”At the end of the session, Aditi Patel , from Symbiosis Center for Media Communication , Viman Nagar, came forward and told everyone about being bullied in childhood. “I had just moved from the US to India and I was that chubby girl with an accent, who did not know how to use the Indian toilet. In simple words, I was a misfit here. I became the ugly girl who had no friends. I was always laughed at. This really affected my self-confidence. However, once I started coming to college, people here accepted and loved me for who I was. It is because of these friends that I could finally walk straight and be proud.”One of the most inspiring stories told was of Bhavna from BVP, Lavale, who shared how it was only after her talent of singing got recognised did she convince her parents to pursue the vocation. “I took my parents for one of my performances and today, they are proud of me. It was my way of convincing them,” she shared.

Title: Varun Dhawan to join hands with ‘Kesari’ director Anurag Singh for his next?
Content: After the release of his last film, ‘Street Dancer 3D’, Varun Dhawan is currently awaiting the release his next which is the official remake of his father David Dhawan’s ‘Coolie No. 1’. The actor presently has his hands full with some very interesting projects which include one with ‘Kesari’ director’s next. According to reports, Varun will be collaborating with ‘Kesari’ director Anurag Singh for his next project. The movie will reportedly be an action thriller film. The other cast and crew of the movie are to be confirmed.The report also added that Varun, who is currently busy with ‘Coolie No. 1’, will next be seen in Sriram Raghavan ’s upcoming biopic on Arun Khetarpal , an army man. After that the actor will reportedly go ahead with Anurag Singh’s action thriller.Varun will be seen sharing the screen space with Sara Ali Khan for the first time in ‘Coolie No. 1’. While Varun will be seen playing the role of Govinda in the film, Sara will be seen stepping into the shoes of Karisma Kapoor . The two actors are super excited for this one and they will be seen shaking a leg to the hit numbers like ‘Ishq Hai Suhana’ and ‘Tujhe Mirchi Lagi Toh Main Kya Karoon’. The original released in 1995 and it was also directed by David Dhawan.While the teaser posters and stills from the sets of the movie have been making their way into the social media, fans are waiting for the trailer of the movie with bated breath.The movie also features Paresh Rawal, Rajpal Yadav, Johnny Lever and others in key roles. It is slated to hit the theatres on May 1, 2020.

Title: Popular mimicry artist in Vijay Sethupathi's next
Content:
Happy to welcome on board #chinnijayanth for MakkalSelvan @VijaySethuOffl ‘s #YaadhumOoreYaavarumKelir.… https://t.co/axBq8fRc24 — venkat prabhu (@vp_offl) 1583840853000

Actor Vijay Sethupathi has resumed the shooting of his film ' Yaadhum Oore Yaavarum Kelir ' directed by debutante Venkata Krishna Roghanth, an erstwhile assistant of SP Jananathan. While the film has Megha Akash playing the leading lady with directors Mohan Raja and Magizh Thirumeni playing an important role, the maker have now roped in a popular mimicry artist into the film.Director Venkat Prabhu unveiled that veteran actor, comedian and mimicry artist Chinni Jayanth will be joining the cast of the film. The Kalaimamani award recipient has been a part of numerous film and he was last seen in Rajinikanth starrer 'Petta'.Touted to be a musical thriller, the film is said to have a socially relevant subject that is very relevant in today's world of instant hatred and negativity that social media has ushered in. The final schedule of shooting is happening in Kodaikanal with which the shooting for the film will be wrapped up.Produced by Chandraa Arts, the film is expected to release in the next few months. While Nivas K Prasanna has scored the music, Vetrivel Mahendran has done the cinematography.

Title: Realme 6 Sale: Realme 6 to go on its first sale today via Flipkart at 12pm
Content:
Realme 6 smartphone is all set to go on its first sale today. The handset will be available on e-commerce site Flipkart along with Realme.com at 12pm. Buyers can also purchase the smartphone from offline retail stores as well.

Realme 6: Price and offers

Realme 6 has three variants. The base model packs 4GB RAM and 64GB onboard storage and is priced at Rs 12,999. The one with 6GB RAM and 128GB storage will be available at Rs 14,999. There is also a 8GB RAM model which can be purchased at Rs 15,999.

As part of today’s sale, buyers will get 5% discount with Axis Bank Buzz credit card. No-cost EMI for the device starts at Rs 1,084 per month.

Realme 6: Specifications

Coming in two colour options — Comet White and Comet Blue, Realme 6 is equipped with a 6.5-inch full HD+ punch-hole display. The screen has a refresh rate of 90Hz and a 1080x2400 pixel resolution. The device is powered by MediaTek Helio G90T and runs on the latest Android 10 operating system topped with the company’s own Realme UI.

On the camera front, Realme 6 boasts of a 16MP in-display selfie camera at the front. Users will get a quad-camera setup with 64MP main sensor, an 8MP ultra-wide-angle lens, 2MP portrait lens, and 2MP depth sensor.

The smartphone comes equipped with a side-mounted fingerprint sensor and is backed by a 4300mAh battery which 30W flash charge support. The company claims that the smartphone can charge completely within 60 minutes.

As stated above, the handset comes with 64GB/128GB internal storage which can be further expanded further by adding a microSD card. It has two RAM options- 6GB and 8GB.

Title: Coronavirus: Air India's Milan-Delhi flight to be taken to remote bay for screening
Content: NEW DELHI: Delhi Airport has made special provisions for Air India ’s Milan-Delhi flight which will be landing on Wednesday morning. Sources say the aircraft will be taken to an isolation bay (number 13) where passengers and crew will alight the Boeing 787 operating as AI 138 from Milan Malpensa using stepladder. They will be individually screened on the tarmac for coronavirus. Italy is seeing the highest number of coronavirus cases outside China.Italian carrier Alitalia had Sunday announced suspension of both domestic and international flights to and from Milan Malpensa airport after the government ordered a lockdown of large areas of northern Italy. Alitalia said it would operate only domestic flights from the smaller Milan Linate airport until at least April 3.A fierce debate is on within Air India whether the airline should continue flying to Italy and South Korea capital Seoul.“Our twice weekly flights from Delhi to Rome and Milan each are going almost empty and we have full loads flying back. There is great risk of infection while flying people back from Italy. Although people from Italy and South Korea need a heath certificate saying they are corona-free to be allowed to enter India, whether someone is infected with this flu is known only after 14 days. So one may be carrying a health certificate but could still be detected to have the flu later,” said a worried senior crew member.Sources say a decision on cancelling AI flights to Italy and Seoul, whose frequencies have been reduced, has not been taken so far due to “national commitment of the national airline”. “We are exposing our crew to great risk of being infected by continuing to fly to Italy. Really hope the government takes a decision on this issue soon,” said another crew member.

Title: Coronavirus in US: US coronavirus cases surge past 1,000, death toll rises to 28
Content: WASHINGTON: The number of novel coronavirus cases in the US surged past 1,000 on Tuesday, after public health experts criticized authorities for downplaying the epidemic and lagging behind in testing efforts.At least 28 people have died and 1,025 people have been infected, according to a running tally by Johns Hopkins University -- nearly double the 550 total confirmed cases the day before.The rise is linked to an expansion in testing as the bulk of diagnoses have shifted from federal to state laboratories.Epidemiologists have said faulty test kits coupled with a diagnostic strategy that initially targeted too few people allowed the disease to spread beyond US authorities' ability to detect it.The failings had contributed to the virus taking root across the country, academics from Johns Hopkins University and Stanford University wrote in the Journal of the American Medical Association (JAMA) on Monday.Vice President Mike Pence defended the government's response at a White House briefing and said that "a million tests are in the field." He said that more would be added as the government partnered with private companies.Just over 8,500 tests had been performed as of Monday, according to the latest figures from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).South Korea announced its first case on the same day as the United States, has tested more than 189,000 people in the same period, Business Insider reported.The JAMA report authors wrote that the only test initially authorized was one developed by the CDC.It relied on the same technology as one authorized by the World Health Organization (WHO) and deployed around the world -- except that a fault meant the CDC kit was returning inconclusive results.It was not until February 29, the date of the first US death and more than a month after the first confirmed US case, that the Food and Drug Administration lifted a ban on state laboratories developing their own kits based on the WHO's tests."Adopting broader testing criteria and allowing use of a wider range of tests would have been helpful in identifying the first US cases and containing the spread," said Michelle Mello of Stanford, a co-author of the JAMA report."Manufacturing problems like the one that arose with CDC's test are always a risk, but the fact that CDC put all its eggs in that one basket made the manufacturing snafu highly consequential," she wrote on her university's blog page.The CDC was initially only testing people with known exposure, meaning a Californian patient on a ventilator was denied the test for five days, the patient's doctors said. The criteria were changed as a result of this case.Mello also pointed to several inaccuracies in White House communications on the epidemic -- from declaring that containment efforts were "close to airtight" to claiming a vaccine could be ready within three to four months."The public messaging from Washington about the seriousness of the problem has been neither consistent nor accurate, and I worry it may have led Americans to take fewer steps to prevent community transmission than we should have," she said.The authors argued against overcorrection, however, saying that health services would be quickly overwhelmed if everyone with a cough or fever -- or exposure to sick patients -- demanded a test.

Title: Man beaten up in Mumbai for molesting girl on railway foot overbridge
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: A fabrication worker has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 17-year-old college girl on the railway foot overbridge at Dadar railway station around 4pm on Monday. He then stalked her to platform 1 where she was waiting to take a train and molested her again.

As the girl screamed for help, the accused, Ranjit Yadav (24), was thrashed by commuters, said senior inspector Prasad Pandhare of Dadar railway police station.

In her complaint, the girl said, "He stalked me from platform 6 after molesting me on the bridge. He kept making obscene acts and followed me up to platform 1 where he sexually harassed me in front of people present on the platform."

Yadav, who lives in Malad , has been booked under section 354 of the Indian Penal Code which deals with outraging a woman's modesty and section 354 (A) which deals with sexual harassment, besides sections of the Pocso Act.

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

Title: Leaky roofs, stinking loos: SWR red flags new coaches for flaws
Content: BENGALURU/CHENNAI: South Western Railway has raised serious safety concerns over a new set of Linke Hofmann Busch coaches manufactured by the Integral Coach Factory at Chennai.SWR has submitted a 59-page report, a copy of which is with TOI, on various defects in the coaches for ICF Chennai to rectify.They include leaky roofs and stinking toilets, in addition to techinal flaws with the potential to cause delinking, derailing and skidding of coaches. A majority of the coaches were manufactured in 2018 and 2019.SWR stated 14 new coaches reported roof leakage, mainly due to improper sealant between coach roof body and Fibre Reinforced Plastic turf or tray in which roof-mounted AC unit is fixed. There are also several issues in double acting doors: The excessive gap at the top and bottom results in loss of cooling. There are also complaints of weak door frames.The report pointed to defects in bus-type sliding shutter windows of non-AC LHB coaches. "Defective lock assembly and jammed sliding shutters are resulting in a number of complaints as passengers are not able to open and close windows," it read. It was found that in 41 LHB coaches, exterior stickers had peeled off from the sidewall/door and mainly in the passenger interface area.Engineers at the maintenance yards are going through a tough time because of the faults.The report said an AC 3-tier coach of train no. 12296 Danapur-Bengaluru Sanghamitra Superfast Express, detached at Bengaluru City coaching depot due to hot axle - overheating of axle box to above 60 degrees Celsius due to fault in bearing, which if unchecked may lead to derailing - on September 21, 2019 during schedule maintenance. "Speed sensor cable probes of seven coaches were damaged ... due to improper torquing of non-standard fasteners used at ICF," it said.Though SWR claimed warranty for faulty parts, most of the replacements have not yet been received from ICF, it said. It also reported primary spring breakage in 77 coaches, including 54 in Sanghamitra Express , 11 in Bengaluru-Kanyakumari Express (train no. 16525/26), five in Rajdhani Bengaluru City Junction-H Nizamuddin (22691/92) and seven in other coachesw.Secondary spring breakage was reported from 12 trains, including eight in Rajdhani, two in Shatabdi Express (Bengaluru-Chennai), one in Bengaluru-Kanyakumari and one in another train. Spring breakage may affect speed and render trains unsafe.Three cases of faulty air brake components were found in the newly built coaches within a short period of the commissioning.Between April and December last year, 27 cases of breakage of control arm lugs, which connect bogies with wheels, were reported, including 24 in Sanghamitra Express. The report also pointed out wrong wiring of speed sensors, raising the risk of skidding and wheel shelling. The report stated there's an increase in breakage of the swinging link pins crucial to fasten the body of the coach and bogie (wheelset). A total 26 coaches were detached due to this in 2018-19.

Title: Madhya Pradesh Government: How the numbers stack up
Content:
How the numbers stack up:

NEW DELHI: As many as 22 Congress MLAs loyal to former Union minister Jyotiraditya Scindia resigned on Tuesday, pushing the 15-month-old Kamal Nath government to the brink of collapse.The resignations came close on the heels of Scindia himself exiting the Congress, telling party chief Sonia Gandhi it was time for him to "move on". There are reports that Scindia could join BJP in Delhi on Wednesday and file his nomination for Rajya Sabha on March 13.Seventeen of the MLAs who have resigned are from the Scindia faction, and two were already incommunicado. Three others joined them, including one brought back from Bengaluru. BJP promptly took the resignations to Speaker NP Prajapati, who said he would take a decision only after legal opinion.In the House of 230, two seats are vacant after the death of Congress MLA Banwarilal Sharma from Jaura assembly seat and BJP MLA Manohar Utwal from Agar-Malwa constituency.If the resignations are accepted, it will reduce Congress's strength in the 230-member assembly to 92, and BJP, with 107 MLAs, could stake claim to form the government. There were also reports of an SP and a BSP MLA - who have so far supported the Congress government - meeting Shivraj Singh Chouhan, the three-time BJP CM.Two BJP MLAs are said to be in touch with chief minister Kamal Nath and have reportedly offered to resign. Upon probable disqualification after defection by these two BJP MLAs, the strength of the House may further reduce to 226. And with the same applied to 22 rebel Congress MLAs, the assembly’s strength will be 204 seats, and simple majority will be at 103. Even in this scenario, the BJP will still have the upper hand.

Title: COVID-19 scare: 'Sooryavanshi', '83 and 'Gunjan Saxena: The Kargil Girl's' release dates to be postponed?
Content: In the wake of the coronavirus outbreak last week the makers of Daniel Craig starrer 'No Time To Die' had announced the that the film's release was being pushed from April 10 to November. Now like the Hollywood filmmakers, Bollywood too is planning to reschedule the upcoming big releases which include ' Sooryavanshi ', ' Gunjan Saxena : The Kargil Girl' and '83 in order to avoid losses. With 12 coronavirus cases in Kerala, the government has decided to shut the public places like theatres until March 31.According to reports, Rohit Shetty is considering to push the release date of Akshay Kumar and Katrina Kaif starrer 'Sooryavanshi' which was slated to release on March 24. His last outing 'Simmba' had opened with great numbers. However, looking at the scenario the numbers 'Sooryavanshi' might open will be too low. Especially in Maharashtra as it one of the important centres for such films and with new cases being confirmed in Nashik and Pune, the footfalls will drop.As far as Kabir Khan 's '83 is concerned the makers have already pushed the trailer launch date and are even thinking to push the release date temporarily. The trailer launch of the Ranveer Singh starrer was originally scheduled to take place today. Also, Karan Johar's production 'Gunjan Saxena: The Kargil Girl' starring Janhvi Kapoor might be moved to a new release date, it was slated to release on April 24. However, nothing yet is officially confirmed from any of the filmmakers' end.

Title: She roughed up a cop to ‘help’ her brother
Content:
woman

police

scooters

stadium

Deekshitha

manhandling

roughed

A 21-year-old, who tried to help her brother retrieve his scooter that had been seized by the police, landed in real trouble after she was arrested and sent to Parappana Agrahara central prisons. The woman, her mother, sister and a few others had come near the Samapangiramanagarand started shouting at the police asking them to release the scooter immediately.The woman’s brother along with a few others were seen moving suspiciously on a scooter and otherinside the Kanteerava Stadium. The jurisdictional Samapangiramanagar police does regular patrolling inside theafter complaints of illegal activities inside the stadium like youths smoking weed, doing stunt rides on bikes and scooters on the roads inside the stadium.During one such patrolling on Sunday evening, a few youths on three to four scooters inside the stadium fled after seeing the police. The woman’s brother who was on a scooter, while trying to flee lost balance and fell on the road. He then abandoned the scooter and managed to escape by scaling the compound wall of the stadium. The police had then seized the scooter and had brought it to the station and had parked it outside.Around 6 pm, the accused along with the other women came near the station and started shouting at the police questioning them as to why they have brought the scooter to the station. As there were less women police personnel present in the station, the other women cops who were on field duty were asked to come to the station immediately as the situation was going out of control. As the accused along with other women were shouting at the police, passers-by too reportedly started gathering.A woman police constable identified as Thejaswi was trying to pacify the accused and her family members when the latter reportedly abused and pushed her. The accused is also alleged to have pulled the constable’s nameplate. The entire incident happened between 6 pm to 7 pm.The accused has been identified as V, a resident of 4th main road in SR Nagar. The woman was arrested at around 7 pm. Along with Deekshitha, complaints have also been registered against her mother and sister fora woman police constable on duty and also for abusing the staff present in the station.“The woman constable was trying to calm the accused asking them to wait till the inspector comes to the station so that he will enquire and will release the vehicle if her brother is not at fault. The accused refused to listen to the woman constable,her up and also started abusing all the staff present in the station,” said an officer.When the inspector came to the station, Deekshitha along with the other women tried to escape from the station premises.“Deekshitha was caught immediately while her mother and sister along with others have managed to escape. She was arrested immediately and after the completion of the formalities, she was sent to jail. Her mother and sister are also been booked and efforts are being made to arrest them. There are complaints that some local youths enter the stadium and indulge in illegal activities,” the officer added.

Title: Juventus-Lyon Champions League game behind closed doors in Turin, says Lyon chief Jean-Michel Aulas
Content:
(AFP Photo)

LYON: Lyon will take on Juventus in the second leg of their Champions League last-16 tie behind closed doors in Turin next week, the French club's president Jean-Michel Aulas told AFP on Tuesday.

Italy has put a stop to all sporting events taking place until April 3 in a country-wide lockdown aimed at slowing the deadly coronavirus outbreak that has killed 631 people in just over two weeks, but competitions which fall under international jurisdiction can be held.

"We have received a letter from UEFA which tells us that the match will be in Turin and behind closed doors," Aulas said to AFP.

Lyon will travel to face the Serie A leaders Juve at the Allianz Stadium on March 17 with a 1-0 lead from the first leg in France and with no home fans to create a hostile atmosphere as they aim to reach the quarter-finals.

"We will take precautions. We will only go to Turin on the day of the match. It is 45 minutes by plane from Lyon," added Aulas.

"We will check the players before travelling there and back. We are also going to disinfect the hotel where we will go before the game."

Atalanta's 4-3 win over Valencia in Spain in the Champions League on Tuesday was played behind closed doors, while no fans will be allowed to attend Wednesday's game between Paris Saint-Germain and Borussia Dortmund in France.

Next week's games between Bayern Munich and Chelsea in Germany and between Barcelona and Napoli in Spain will also go ahead behind closed doors.

Juventus seemed unaffected by the lack of home support at the weekend as they beat Inter Milan 2-0 in a ghostly atmosphere, their last Serie A match until the government withdraws its current decree.

Lyon will have to play their domestic matches behind closed doors until April 15 following a decision by the French football league on Tuesday.

Title: Trio drops man from 11th floor in Kondhwa
Content:
accused

Kondhwa

monetary dispute

police

Indian Penal Code

A 26-year-old man was allegedly dropped to his death from his 11th floor rented accommodation inby three of his flatmates over. The incident took place in the wee hours of Tuesday morning. The trio, who reportedly fled from the scene after committing the crime, later surrendered before Kondhwa, confessing their involvement in the killing. The three, all of them engineering students, have been arrested by Kondhwa police. The deceased has been identified as Sagar Chilveri (26), a resident of Kul Utsav Society, Kondhwa Budruk.Abhinabhav Jadhav, Akshay Gorade and Tejash Gujar, the three accused in the case, shared their apartment with Sagar. Some three months ago, the deceased had supposedly borrowed Rs 15,000 from Abhinabhav and promised to return the sum by March with a 10 per cent interest. However, since Sagar was without a job, he was unable to stick to his work. The lapse in payment angered Abhinabhav, who decided to “teach Sagar a lesson”. He, along with the other two flatmates, assaulted Sagar on the evening of March 10 and brought him back home, where the security guard at the society gate stopped them and asked what the issue was, cops said. The accused apparently had an argument with the watchman and told him that they had a minor scuffle over financial issues. Although Sagar sought help from the security guard, stating that his life could be in danger if he went back to the apartment with the trio, officials informed. The three men, however, assured the guard that the fight was over.Later in the night, the society watchmen heard a scream. When they looked around, they saw a lifeless body lying on the complex premises and identified the deceased as Sagar. Shocked, the guards immediately called the police. However, the three accused allegedly escaped the spot from another gate. Sagar’s body was sent to Sassoon General Hospitals for a post-mortem.According to police, the deceased, who worked in a bakery, had only recently joined an event management company. Sagar was introduced to the three accused through a common friend when he was looking for a shared accommodation, cops said. While Abhinabhav is a final-year civil engineering student, Akshay is a third-year mechanical engineering student and Tejash, a first-year engineering student, officials informed. Police officers further said that while the deceased didn’t have parents, he leaves behind two sisters who are settled in Pune.“When Abhinabhav called Sagar to enquire about the dues, the latter was on his way to Swargate. The three accused went to Swargate and threatened and beat up Sagar and dragged him to their bike to bring him home with them. When they reached their society, the security guard tried to sort out the matter, but they even threatened the security guard and asked him to pay on Sagar’s behalf. Sagar apparently implored the boys to let him go and sought time to return the money. He even wanted to spend the night at the guard’s cabin to avoid the boys. The accused, however, assured him and the guard that all was fine. Later when the watchmen heard the scream, they figured that Sagar was pushed down by the accused,” informed cops.Mahadev Kumbhar, police inspector attached to Kondhwa police station told Mirror, “A case has been filed against the accused under section 302 (murder), 323 (punishment for voluntarily causing hurt), 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace), 506 (punishment for criminal intimidation), 34 (acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention) of the(IPC).”

Title: NSUI drubs ABVP, embarrasses BJP
Content:
Amit Shah

Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad

Gujarat University

Mahipal Gadhvi

ABVP alleges NSUI won as majority colleges are Cong-dominated and they pressurised students to vote for them

Indravijaysinh Gohil

Dhrumil Patel

GU Senate Election

GU team heaves sigh of relief

St Xavier’s student shines bright

Voices

Candidates of Cong's student wing NSUI won on six of eight senate seats and nine of the 14 welfare seats in polls held on SundayOn a day when Congress was embroiled in high-voltage drama in Madhya Pradesh, its students' wing National Students Union of India brought in cheer for the party in PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister's home state of Gujarat. Repeating its 2015 performance, NSUI trumped Akhilin thesenate and welfare election, held after four years.ABVP suffered a massive drubbing at the hands of NSUI whose candidates won on six of eight senate seats that went to polls on Sunday. ABVP candidates won two seats including the largest faculty seats of Under Graduate Commerce. Senate elections were held for 10 seats on Sunday, the results of which were announced on Monday. Two seats of Medical faculty and Dental faculty had winners uncontested. Later in the day, however, both ABVP and NSUI unions claimed that the winning candidates extended support to them. In 2015, NSUI had won six in senate and nine in welfare elections, according to NSUI State PresidentIn the 14 Welfare seats that went to polls simultaneously, nine went to NSUI and five to ABVP, according to the list of winners shared by Gujarat University officials.Congress'said,"It is because of NSUI's connect with students and fighting against ABVP's ideology that NSUI is winning student's trust and love," he said. NSUI members said that voter's rejection of ABVP candidates is also their rejection of the divisive politics of the BJP, the student wing's patron party. ABVP's win on only two seats has also raised eyebrows among varsity officials as BJP has prominent members -- Pankaj Shukla, Kaushik Jain, Vanraj Chavda,-- in the Executive Council, GU's decision making body, besides BJP-leaning leadership in Vice Chancellor Himanshu Pandya and Pro-Vice Chancellor Jagdish Bhavsar.ABVP claimed that NSUI had upper hand in the election as majority of the colleges belong to Congress members and alleged that they have been pressurising students, asking them to vote for NSUI or face consequences. "ABVP knew they were not going to win and so they have been trying hard to cancel election. If they worked hard on ground, they could have saved themselves from an embarrassing win on just two seats," said Gohil. NSUI State President Mahipalsinh Gadhvi said that Monday's development is a testimony to the fact that even if BJP government puts its entire machinery including MLAs, VC, PVC , college principals and hostel rectors against NSUI, sensible voters will not be swayed by it and will choose ideology of unity over divisive tactics. "ABVP believes in destructive ideology and they get active only when elections are round the corner. Young voters do not want divisive politics," he said. Kaushik Jain, a BJP executive council member, said ABVP worked hard this election."BJP may be in power and has VC and PVC at GU from the party, but we do not use BJP's power in student election. We do not force students to vote for ABVP by blackmailing them saying they will fail in the exams if they don't do so. BJP ministers did not help them," said Jain.If there was anyone more relieved than the candidates who had been canvassing for a month, it was Gujarat (GU)’s teaching and non-teaching staff that worked day and night to make this election possible. GU officials like Hitesh Gadhvi faced the wrath of protesting ABVP members multiple times but was smiling ear to ear after the varsity pulled off an election without hassles and announced results on Monday. A pat on the back for all who did not give into aggression or abuse.The highlight of NSUI’s stellar performance in Gujarat University’s Welfare election that saw it grab 9 of 14 seats was Amaani Vaniya who won a welfare seat by crossing the majority mark of 100 votes. Those associated with GU’s elections said she is the first female to pass the majority quota in the history of GU. Amaani, the youngest candidate, says she did it without identity politics and political backing. She is aUG student of English literature at St Xavier’s College .

Title: Rajinikanth: Actor Rajinikanth may announce political party tomorrow
Content:
Rajinikanth

CHENNAI: Actor Rajinikanth is expected to make an important announcement regarding his political launch on Thursday.

Six days after holding a meeting of the Rajini Makkal Mandram (RMM) district secretaries, the actor will meet with the office-bearers again on Thursday, when the announcement is expected.

RMM functionaries confirmed to TOI that they received calls from Rajinikanth’s office on Tuesday night, asking them to be present at 9am on Thursday at a marriage hall owned by the actor in Chennai. Multiple sources said that the actor is likely to spell out his political programme that would include the formal launch of a party in the coming days.

Stakes are high for AIADMK and DMK in the upcoming Tamil Nadu election scheduled in May 2021. While chief minister and AIADMK joint coordinator Edappadi K Palaniswami and deputy chief minister and party coordinator O Panneerselvam will be fighting for political survival, for M K Stalin, who has had a long wait to give governance a shot, the poll fight is crucial to cement his leadership after the death of his father and former DMK chief M Karunanidhi.

For 69-year-old Rajini, the political battle blueprint, which has been in the making for a while, has to succeed in the upcoming assembly election, for him to sustain a decent tenure in Dravidian politics. The actor is expected to spell out the party structure, besides give indication of his alliance plans.



In Video: Chennai: Rajini to meet RMM functionaries tomorrow, likely to announce party

Title: Maharashtra: Now, ration shops can sell basmati rice, vegetables, milk
Content: MUMBAI: The food and civil supplies department on Monday allowed the 55,000 fair price shops, also known as ration shops, across the state to sell items other than those prescribed under the public distribution scheme (PDS) to make them sustainable and viable.Currently, fair price shop owners are allowed to sell only rice, wheat, coarse grain and sugar. Now, they can also sell all varieties of rice, including basmati, edible and palm oil, pulses, jaggery, groundnut, rawa, maida, vegetables and all varieties of wheat. In addition, they have been permitted to sell certified seeds, milk and other products of Mahananda and Aarey, products of Maharashtra Agro-Industries Development Corporation and Kolhapur based Khadi Gramodyog Sangh, which manufactures eco-friendly insecticide and sanitary napkins.An official said that fair price shops will now be allowed to sale all items required by schoolchildren as well as stationery. “Fair price shop owners will have to enter into an agreement with these organizations at their level, government will not be responsible for their transactions,” he said.Food and civil supplies minister Chhagan Bhujbal told TOI: “The proposal was pending with the food and civil supplies department for a prolonged time. We found that many fair price shops were on the verge of closure, therefore, we granted them permission to sell items other than listed under the public distribution system.”A senior food and civil department official said, since a new order has been passed, the government expects that pilferage will come to a halt. “We expect that fair price shop owners may improve their business, as a result, now the business may be viable. We are in the process of enhancing their commission too,” the official added.

Title: Shahid Kapoor gets trained under cricketer Rohit Sharma’s coach for ‘Jersey’?
Content: After the super success of ‘ Kabir Singh ’, Shahid Kapoor is all set to star in yet another Telugu remake ‘ Jersey ’ where he will be seen playing a cricketer. The actor is leaving no stone unturned to get into the skin of the character he is playing. According to reports, the makers of ‘Jersey’ have roped in cricketer Rohit Sharma ’s coach and mentor Dinesh Lad to train Shahid. The producers of the film reportedly decided to get a reputed coach to train Shahid and Gowtam Tinnanuri too agreed for the same. The actor is being trained under State-level Ranji Trophy coaches too for the film.Not only that, an eight-member team, including certified athletic trainers and fitness experts from UK, has been hired to help Shahid to get into the skin of his character. Shahid Kapoor has earlier played cricket at the college and club levels.The report also stated that Shahid is thrilled with the opportunity to learn under Dinesh. He has been working on the batting techniques with Dinesh Lad for a few sessions during the initial schedules of the shooting in November. He also picked up the footwork and different styles of stroke play from the renowned coach.Reportedly, half the shooting has been completed, but Shahid continues to train under Ranji coaches. Since the film is now being shot in Chandigarh, the actor is training under Haryana state coaches. He hits the nets whenever opportunity arises, and during shooting breaks.The movie will also star Mrunal Thakur of ‘Super 30’ fame in key role.

Title: 'NRI suitor' dupes Mumbai woman of Rs 3 lakh
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: A month after registering her profile on a matrimonial website, a 32-year-old woman from Saki Naka, was cheated of nearly Rs 3 lakh by a man masquerading as a suitor and claiming to be an NRI.

The conman, who identified himself as Niraj Kapoor, told the woman he was on a visit to India to meet her. He made the victim transfer Rs 2.98 lakh to a bank account, claiming he had been detained by Customs officials at Delhi airport for carrying undeclared goods and US dollars.

Saki Naka police registered the case on Monday after the fraudsters demanded another Rs 6 lakh.

The victim, employed with a private firm, lodged a complaint after she rang a friend at Delhi airport and learnt no one called Sonia Sharma was employed with customs there.

A woman claiming to be customs official Sonia Sharma had called her to ask money for Kapoor's release. "The victim registered the case after the conman got in touch with her through a matrimonial site. The cyber team is probing the case," said senior inspector Kishore Sawant. The victim was duped on March 3 and 4.

Title: UEFA asking governments to ensure Euro 2020 goes ahead
Content:
LONDON: UEFA is asking governments across the continent to ensure the European Championship goes ahead in three months despite the coronavirus outbreak .

Based on advice received from the World Health Organization, UEFA believes a city can host Euro 2020 games if it has the medical infrastructure to treat COVID-19 patients while still providing the necessary facilities to cope with tens of thousands of fans, a person with knowledge of the planning told The Associated Press on Tuesday.

The person spoke on condition of anonymity to discuss private planning conversations.

UEFA is using 12 stadiums in 12 nations for this unique pan-European tournament, which provides flexibility to give a city additional games if another is prevented from doing so due to the coronavirus. UEFA would remove games from a city if necessary to ensure the 24-team tournament can go ahead, the person said.

Brussels was already stripped of hosting because its stadium wasn't finished and additional games were placed at Wembley, which has the semifinals and final in north London.

UEFA said reports that European football federations had requested that the 24-team tournament is moved to next year were “completely untrue."

“UEFA has had no requests to move or cancel the tournament,” the governing body told the AP.

Officials from European football's governing body have been working with the WHO to form a plan to mitigate the risks from the COVID-19 disease across the 12 countries due to stage games.

UEFA has been told by the WHO that it does not expect the virus to have been contained by the time Euro 2020 opens on June 12 in Rome, the persons with with knowledge of the planning said. No sports events are currently taking place in Italy after the country was put in effective lockdown by the government this week.

“UEFA takes the situation linked to the coronavirus very seriously,” the Nyon, Switzerland-based organization said in a statement.

“We are closely monitoring the situation and are in contact with the World Health Organisation and national authorities regarding COVID-19 and its development.”

UEFA wants Euro 2020 to take place with fans. But some European club competition games are taking place this week in empty stadiums, including Paris Saint-Germain's last-16 meeting in the Champions League with Borussia Dortmund on the orders of French authorities.

Decisions have already been made for later this month. Ireland's Euro 2020 playoff match against Slovakia on March 26 will be played without fans on the instruction of the Slovakian government. Supporters will be barred from the stadium in Nuremberg for Germany's friendly against Italy on March 31.

Like the IOC with the Tokyo Olympics, UEFA is trying to ensure its flagship event is not derailed by the virus. Cities in Azerbaijan, Denmark, Germany, Hungary, Ireland, the Netherlands, Romania, Russia, Scotland and Spain will also stage games.

The new coronavirus causes only mild or moderate symptoms for most people, such as fever and cough, and the vast majority recover. But it can cause more severe illness, including pneumonia for some, especially older adults and people with existing health problems.

Title: ‘Tonic’ teaser creates a buzz
Content: Starring Dev and Paran Bandopadhyay in the lead and directed by Avijit Sen, ‘ Tonic ’ promises to deliver sublime humor with a social message on a strong note.It’s a story of a retired person who faced many ups and down in life to fulfill his dream to celebrate his special day in a special way. How he succeeds to do so is the crux of the story. Recently the teaser was dropped online and it has already sent the social media into a tizzy.The film revolves around a possessive son and his father. It shows how a son’s over-possessiveness affects their relationship. The problem becomes severe when the son celebrates his parents’ 50th anniversary in a low-key way, but makes sure his own anniversary is celebrated in a grand way. Dev’s character comes in between the father-son relationship and we see how he tries to make things better.‘Tonic’ also stars Shakuntala Barua , Neel and Koneenica Bandopadhyay. Sujoy Dutta Roy is the Editor, while Supriyo Dutta is the DOP of the movie. Jeet Ganguly has composed the songs.The social drama is scheduled to release on May 8.

Title: Delay of 1-2 years 'feasible' if Tokyo Games can't go ahead in summer: Official
Content: TOKYO: A delay of one or two years would be the "most feasible" option if the Tokyo Olympics cannot be held this summer due to the global outbreak of the coronavirus , a member of the organising committee's executive board has told Reuters.Haruyuki Takahashi, one of more than two dozen members of the Tokyo 2020 executive board, said the body had just started looking at scenarios for how the virus could affect the Games.Takahashi has earlier told the Wall Street Journal that the board had not discussed the impact of the virus, having last met in December before the epidemic spread.Organisers have been pushing a consistent message that the Games would not be cancelled or postponed but sponsors who have pumped in billions of dollars have grown increasingly nervous about how the coronavirus outbreak will impact the event.Takahashi told Reuters that the financial damage from cancelling the Games or holding them without spectators would be too great, while a delay of less than a year would clash with other major professional sports schedules."We need to start preparing for any possibility. If the Games can't be held in the summer, a delay of one or two years would be most feasible," Takahashi said.Experts say a one-year postponement to the same time next year would pose major logistical problems but was doable for broadcasters because it fits into their generally open summer schedule.The new coronavirus has infected more than 116,000 people and killed more than 4,000 around the world since it surfaced in China late last year.Japan has reported nearly 1,300 cases, including about 700 from a cruise ship that was quarantined near Tokyo last month. On Tuesday, it saw the biggest number of infections in a single day, of 59 cases, according to public broadcaster NHK.With every new spike in the figures, speculation has swirled that the Tokyo 2020 Games , due to open on July 24, could be cancelled, delayed, or held without spectators, like many pre-Olympic qualifiers and other unrelated sports events have been in the run-up.

Title: Meezaan Jafri on shooting for 'Hungama 2': Nobody knows what's happening except Priyadarshan Sir
Content: Last year, Meezaan Jafri debuted in Sanjay Leela Bhansali ’s 'Malaal', a film about young love, and now is all set to follow in the footsteps of his grandfather Jagdeep and dad Jaaved Jaaferi and experiment with comedy genre in 'Hungama 2'. The film, which marks Priyadarshan ’s comeback to Bollywood after seven years, also features Paresh Rawal, Shilpa Shetty and Pranitha Subhash.“Comedy is one of the most difficult genres and Priyan sir shoots in a unique way. You are given the dialogues just before the shot. He shows you how to play it out on camera and you just have to follow his cues. Nobody knows what is happening on the set except him. I spoke with Akshay Kumar sir on the sets of 'Sooryavanshi' about this and he told me to blindly follow Priyan sir; it will turn out great. He confessed that whatever he has learnt about comedy is from the filmmaker,” shares the young actor who gave his nod to the film after hearing that Priyadarshan would be helming it without even hearing the script. “I have a special connect with Priyan sir. My grandfather acted in his first Hindi film, 'Muskurahat'.”The actor admits that working with a strong ensemble cast was a bit unnerving initially. “During the first few days, I was dying, literally,” he laughs, admitting that he was petrified to be standing beside actors he had idolised all his life. “The rest of the cast share a great camaraderie with Priyan sir, having worked with him earlier. It was like home ground for them and they were completely chilled out,” he reminisces.Did he take any tips from his father or grandfather? “No, I was too scared that once I start a conversation, it would never end,” he guffaws, reasoning that living up to their expectations would have been difficult as they excel in their craft.In the Hungama sequel, Jafri Jr sports a completely different look from his first film and admits that many from the frat failed to recognise him. “Once I was chatting with Salman (Khan) sir... midway through the conversation it dawned on him who I was. A similar thing happened with Amit ( Amitabh Bachchan ) sir at his Diwali bash,” he chuckles.Given how happy Meezaan looks, you hate asking if the failure of his first film took a toll. “You do get attached to a project when you are a part of it, but at the end, you can’t pinpoint a single thing that didn’t work. And the good thing was that people appreciated me, which is why I am getting so much work now,” he says.In an era of remakes, is there a role of his father’s that he’d like to recreate. Pat comes the reply, “His character from Meri Jung a sexy, cool villain, who also dances.” However, for the moment, he would like to step into the action genre next.

Title: Mumbai: Lookout note out for Dubai drug supplier
Content:
Kailash Rajput

MUMBAI: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has issued a lookout circular (LOC) for a Dubai-based “notorious fugitive drug supplier”, Kailash Rajput alias KR, who is emerging as one of the biggest drug supplier to many countries .

Though the Delhi special cell of Delhi police and the Anti Narcotic Cell of Mumbai police have been looking for Rajputin drug cases, his name cropped up in a fresh case filed by DRI last month.

In February, DRI arrested three from Navi Mumbai with 50kg of mephedroneor meowmeow, a banned synthetic narcotic worth Rs 20 crore.

During interrogation, it transpired that they were working at the behest of Rajput. Offficials said Rajput is a key person who finances raw material and controls drug sale in the UAE.

Title: Maharashtra: Don't park funds in private banks, departments told
Content:
Picture used for representational purpose only

MUMBAI: In the wake of RBI issuing stringent guidelines and the subsequent arrest of Yes Bank founder chairman Rana Kapoor, the state government has asked all departments, state-run corporations and civic organizations not to park their funds in private banks.

A top bureaucrat told TOI the Yes Bank crisis was discussed at the weekly cabinet meeting. It was concluded that for the safety and security of government funds, all departments and state-run corporations should be directed to park their funds in nationalized banks. "No more parking of funds in private banks, funds should be deposited exclusively in nationalized banks," he said. The bureaucrat pointed out the crisis in the Yes Bank would have an adverse impact on the rural economy as well as the much-publicized loan waiver scheme since most banks in the rural sector have their accounts in Yes Bank. Chief minister Uddhav Thackeray has declared a loan waiver scheme to provide relief to farmers with loans worth Rs 2 lakh. The government is in the process of expanding the scheme to include more farmers.

The bureaucrat said the home department was the first to raise an alarm over the financial crisis in Yes Bank. Following media reports over the state of affairs in the bank, the home department had asked the State Security Corporation headed by additional chief secretary, Sanjay Kumar, to immediately withdraw its fixed deposits in the bank and park them in nationalized banks.

Title: Turkey announces first coronavirus case
Content: ISTANBUL: Turkey announced on Wednesday its first coronavirus case, a man who had recently travelled to Europe and is in good health. "The test of a patient suspected of carrying the coronavirus returned positive," health minister Fahrettin Koca said in a television broadcast.He added that the man was likely to have contracted Covid-19 while travelling in Europe, but declined to say which country or where in Turkey the patient had been hospitalised.The minister also called on Turkish citizens to avoid travelling abroad if possible.Turkey, a tourist hub linking Europe and western Asia , had around 50 million visitors last year.It has a population of 80 million and shares a border with Greece , Bulgaria, Georgia, Armenia, Syria, Iraq and Iran , the country with the third-most infections worldwide.Turkey has announced several measures in recent weeks to try and stop the virus reaching the country, including thermal cameras at airports, cancelling flights to affected countries and closing its border with Iran.Hospitals in Istanbul and the capital Ankara have been set up to test and quarantine patients suspected of having the virus.After erupting in the Chinese city of Wuhan in December, the novel coronavirus has now affected societies and economies on all continents except Antarctica.There are more than 117,000 coronavirus cases, with 4,251 deaths across 107 countries and territories, according to a tally compiled by AFP.

Title: V Manohar to judge singing show Gaana Chandana
